The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

House of Cards
  You are standing in the middle of a large field. The field itself is nearly 
empty other than the colorful blue and green tent that now bars your path. A 
small sign hangs on the tent from the open flap. From inside you can hear
much laughter and talking. In fact, you're somewhat surprised that so much
noise is coming from such a small tent. Perhaps you should investigate the 
source of so much noise.

Jokers' Room
  The Jokers' room is filled with every color you can imagine, like a rainbow
of endless colors. It is hard to concentrate with so much fighting for your
attention at the same time. Several large colorful cards wander here, their
paints clashing with the decor of the room. Resentful at being left out of
almost every card game, rarely being used, the jokers stumble around this
colorful room telling jokes to one another with their sharpened tongues.
Only a brave soul would dare to challenge them to a game, and only a fool
would pick a fight.

[ Exits: north south ]

Trump Cards
  Taking only a few seconds for your eyes to adjust to your new surroundings,
the sudden lack of color almost makes you feel sad. But the splendor in which 
the room you have entered is kept, helps keep you feeling warm and happy. The
finest card in all the land has been used to build the walls here, and fine
furniture has been placed around the room. You wonder how so much detail has
been added in such a small card deck, then you see to whom this room belongs.
This card stands twice as tall and twice as thick as any of the other cards you
have seen.

Trump Cards
  Taking only a few seconds for your eyes to adjust to your new surroundings,
the sudden lack of color almost makes you feel sad. But the splendor in which 
the room you have entered is kept, helps keep you feeling warm and happy. The
finest card in all the land has been used to build the walls here, and fine
furniture has been placed around the room. You wonder how so much detail has
been added in such a small card deck, then you see to whom this room belongs.
This card stands twice as tall and twice as thick as any of the other cards you
have seen.

[ Exits: south west ]

Wistful Hand
  Compared to the rest of the deck this room is surprisingly barren and empty.
The card walls here are plain, colorless and with a distinct lack of anything.
Only simple unpainted cards wander here, free of suit and color.

Trump Cards
  Taking only a few seconds for your eyes to adjust to your new surroundings,
the sudden lack of color almost makes you feel sad. But the splendor in which 
the room you have entered is kept, helps keep you feeling warm and happy. The
finest card in all the land has been used to build the walls here, and fine
furniture has been placed around the room. You wonder how so much detail has
been added in such a small card deck, then you see to whom this room belongs.
This card stands twice as tall and twice as thick as any of the other cards you
have seen.

s
Jokers' Room
  The Jokers' room is filled with every color you can imagine, like a rainbow
of endless colors. It is hard to concentrate with so much fighting for your
attention at the same time. Several large colorful cards wander here, their
paints clashing with the decor of the room. Resentful at being left out of
almost every card game, rarely being used, the jokers stumble around this
colorful room telling jokes to one another with their sharpened tongues.
Only a brave soul would dare to challenge them to a game, and only a fool
would pick a fight.

[ Exits: north south ]
(Red Aura) (White Aura) (Angry) This card has the picture of a Joker on it.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) (Angry) This card has the picture of a Joker on it.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) (Angry) This card has the picture of a Joker on it.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) (Angry) This card has the picture of a Joker on it.
A Joker asks, "Why did the chicken cross the road?"

[*Daily Blessing*] 2997/3308 HP  1765/3788 MP  2201/2201 mv  351tnl  
Lv 127  G 165435 | Jokers' Room (NS)
>>    
s
In a Deck
  Smoke fills the air of this small room making it hard to see the walls or 
even make out what you're standing on. You're not sure if smoking inside a 
cardboard box is wise, but then this is evidently not like the world you're 
used to. As the smoke shifts for a second you notice several giant walking 
cards.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) A sign made of card points what's where.
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) A card stating the rules, watches everything here.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) This card looks totally WILD!
(Golden Aura) A dealer stands here smoking constantly.
James, the card dealer winks at you.
James, the card dealer says, "Welcome back, enjoy yourself."

[*Daily Blessing*] 2997/3308 HP  1765/3788 MP  2201/2201 mv  351tnl  
Lv 127  G 165435 | In a Deck (NESW)
>>    
w
A Game of Poker
  Here the cards spend most of their free time. And everyone knows that when
cards aren't out and about being used for card games, there is nothing they
enjoy more than a good old game of poker. Here several large cards use
themselves to place bets and gamble against themselves. They appear to be
betting using scraps of card, and you wonder which poor card was killed to
produce this game's funding.

[ Exits: north east west ]
(Red Aura) A poker chip is loose in the room!
(Red Aura) A poker chip is loose in the room!

[*Daily Blessing*] 3040/3308 HP  1847/3788 MP  2201/2201 mv  351tnl  
Lv 127  G 165435 | A Game of Poker (NEW)
>>    
n
The Bluff
  The room is silent as each card tries to stare out the other. None willing
to admit he has nothing in his hand, the bluff is played. Painted eyes meet
across the tables, faces stiff as the card they're painted on. Was that a
nervous twitch or a smile? Does he think simply smiling will mislead me?
Or perhaps he already thought I would think that......... but that means he
knew I would think that also ............... so what do I play?

[ Exits: south west ]
(Red Aura) A shark made of cards is here!
(Translucent) (Red Aura) A poker chip is loose in the room!
(Red Aura) A shark made of cards is here!
(Red Aura) A shark made of cards is here!

l;ex
The Bluff
  The room is silent as each card tries to stare out the other. None willing
to admit he has nothing in his hand, the bluff is played. Painted eyes meet
across the tables, faces stiff as the card they're painted on. Was that a
nervous twitch or a smile? Does he think simply smiling will mislead me?
Or perhaps he already thought I would think that......... but that means he
knew I would think that also ............... so what do I play?

[*Daily Blessing*] 1309/3308 HP  1066/3878 MP  2201/2156 mv  161tnl  
Lv 127  G 170315 | The Bluff (SW)
>>    WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1309/3308 HP  1066/3878 MP  2201/2156 mv  161tnl  
Lv 127  G 170315 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1309/3308 HP  1066/3788 MP  2200/2201 mv  161tnl  
Lv 127  G 170315 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     An old electric heater.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the

adventurers.

Low Hearts
  Although your surroundings are somewhat humble and meager there is a certain
warmth about the room you find yourself now standing in. The occasional heart
is painted on the card walls surrounding you, and several of the heart cards

cards then winning a game of cards if you're a heart.

[*Daily Blessing*] 1694/3342 HP  3300/3825 MP  2219/2219 mv  849tnl  
Lv 128  G 96417 | Low Hearts (NS)
>>    

The Stakes are high, the Deck is shuffled, the Cards are dealt.

help scorch
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Scorch.
Help Category : Attack Spell.
Related Helps : Burning Hands, Fireball.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-26 14:24:34.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'scorch' <victim>
Damage: fire
Spell Number: 350

A MUCH more powerful version of the Burning Hands spell, Scorch sends wave
after wave of burning flame into the enemy, incinerating them in a blast
furnace of heat.  This attack targets only one opponent.

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Low Hearts
  Although your surroundings are somewhat humble and meager there is a certain
warmth about the room you find yourself now standing in. The occasional heart
is painted on the card walls surrounding you, and several of the heart cards 
are here preparing some form of a banquet. Although they too have royalty and
classes, the great card house of hearts appears to be less strict on its
mingling between classes and other houses. Its more about playing a game of
cards then winning a game of cards if you're a heart.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Acid Wave'.
Help Category : Attack Spell.
Related Helps : Fire Breath, Ice Cloud, Shock Aura, Toxic Cloud.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-18 19:56:49.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'acid wave' <target>
Damage: acid
Spell Number: 83

A powerful magic-user can summon the power of the mightiest of black dragons,
belching forth a wave of corrosive acid.  This spell targets a single
individual/monster.

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.

seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) Forma not formatted.

Castle Gates
  Above you loom the great iron gates of Castle Caraway.  Threadbare
banners still snap and wave along the side of the gates, speaking of a
happier day for this benighted realm.  Peasants trudge along this road,
scattering when they see you.  You wonder what great catastrophe could have
struck to make such a peaceful realm into a warzone.  Suddenly, you are
almost run down by a troop of horsemen who are galloping madly away from the
castle.  One of them calls to you as he passes, "Flee, neighbor, while you
can!  A dragon has kidnapped the princess and would ravage all the land!"  

[ Exits: (north) south ]

Lv 129  G 77662 | Castle Gates (NS)
>>    Great Hall
  You have entered the foyer of Castle Caraway.  You stop in awe as you
gaze upon the workmanship of this famed castle.  Huge marble blocks carved
with roses form the arching, cathedral-like room. Suits of armor worn by
the heroes of days past line these walls.  Yet, within the peaceful
stillness of the castle, a low hum of dismay can be discerned.  To the north
lies the grand hallway of the castle, while to the south is the castle
entrance.  Doors to the east and west hide further mysteries.

A Long Hallway
  You stand in the grand hall of the Castle of Caraway.  All around you,
courtiers hurry here and there, talking in low whispers.  A chill air lies
upon the castle, as if some great doom had befallen the inhabitants.  A red
velvet carpet runs down the middle of the hall, leading north into the
Throne room, and south into the foyer.  East and west lie lesser hallways.

[**> PK <**] >>    
n
A Long Hallway
  This is the west hall of Castle Caraway.  Torches in sconces line the
walls, casting a fitful light across the carpet.  The shadows reach up
across the ceiling, hiding any details from you, but you have the uneasy
feeling that something moved up there.  To the east lies the grand hall, and
there are closed doors to the north and south.  

[ Exits: (north) east south ]
A dark lord sniffs condescendingly.
A dark lord sniffs condescendingly.
(Golden Aura) A gentle-looking courtier smiles at you.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3114/3372 HP  3406/3865 MP  2239/2240 mv  879tnl  
Lv 129  G 82708 | A Long Hallway (NES)
>>    Sir Lauren's Room
  The room you have entered into reminds you of a prince's room.  Silk and
satin, all in shades of white and silver, cover practically every inch of
this bower of lordliness.  An armor stand rests in one corner, bare now of
the accouterments that once graced its form.  The bed is tastefully
decorated with a unicorn rampant counterpane, and the cherrywood frame is
carved delicately with scenes of unicorns and roses.  

[ Exits: south ]
(Golden Aura) Squire Thomas looks at you despairingly.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3114/3372 HP  3406/3865 MP  2238/2240 mv  879tnl  
Lv 129  G 82708 | A Long Hallway (NES)
e
>>    
A Long Hallway
  You stand in the grand hall of the Castle of Caraway.  All around you,
courtiers hurry here and there, talking in low whispers.  A chill air lies
upon the castle, as if some great doom had befallen the inhabitants.  A red
velvet carpet runs down the middle of the hall, leading north into the
Throne room, and south into the foyer.  East and west lie lesser hallways.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3114/3372 HP  3406/3865 MP  2238/2240 mv  879tnl  
Lv 129  G 82708 | A Long Hallway (NESW)
>>    
n
Throne Room
  You stand in a large room with huge arching windows.  You pause for a
moment to admire the windows, which are stained glass representations of
roses in glory and unicorns.  Then your eyes are drawn to the head of the
room, where two golden thrones sit.  The courtiers of the court part for you
as you approach the monarchs of this grand castle.  There is an aura of
despair and sorrow that seem to congeal about you almost physically as you
draw nearer the king and queen.  You see that the queen is sobbing quietly
into her handkerchief and the king is grimly talking to several of his
knights.  He sees you and beckons you forward with a glad cry.  

[ Exits: north (east) south (west) ]
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) Queen Brunhilda weeps into her handkerchief.
(Golden Aura) (White Aura) King Rupert stares at you grimly.
(Golden Aura) Sir Bedwyr attends the king most assiduously.

Lv 129  G 82708 | A Long Hallway (NESW)

e
A Long Hallway
  This is the east hall of Castle Caraway.  Candles in tall stands line the
wall, casting a clear, gleaming light across the floor.  The shadows are
banished here, and you can see the roof is scrolled with graceful
fleur-de-lies and roses.  The alcoves lining the east wall are filled with
statues of maidens and unicorns.  North and south doorways lead into private
rooms, and the hallway stretches to the west.  

[ Exits: (north) south west ]
A dark lord sniffs condescendingly.
(Golden Aura) A gentle-looking courtier smiles at you.
(Golden Aura) A gentle-looking courtier smiles at you.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3114/3372 HP  3406/3865 MP  2235/2240 mv  879tnl  
Lv 129  G 82708 | A Long Hallway (NSW)
>>    Gilda's Room
  You have entered into what is obviously the room of a princess.  Pink and
pearl are evident everywhere, in the draperies surrounding the bed, in the
curtains lining the windows, even in the colour schemes of the dressers and
chests.  This cult of colour seems unrelieved everywhere, until you catch a
glimpse of something dark on the bed.  You take a closer look and draw back
with alarm as you recognize a blue dragon's scale lying on the headboard.

[ Exits: south ]
(Golden Aura) Lady Serina weeps into her knitting.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3114/3372 HP  3406/3865 MP  2234/2240 mv  879tnl

[*Daily Blessing*] 3114/3372 HP  3406/3865 MP  2231/2240 mv  879tnl  
Lv 129  G 82708 | Throne Room (NES[W])
>>    Prince Humphrey's Quarters [**> PK <**]
  You have entered the twilight zone.  Leave your coat by the door and have
a look around.  Prince Humphrey's room is a crazy collection of the bizarre
and strange.  You take a quick look in the fishtank near the door, and
shudder in horror.  A cat with no fur and a dog's tail tears past you, and
skulls of a large variety of animals glare at you from the bookshelves. 
Upon the bed rests a counterpane of solid black, and hanging from the
ceiling are herbs and other objects you'd rather not examine too closely.  

[ Exits: west ]
(White Aura) Prince Humphrey had obviously experimented once too often with his...herbs.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3114/3372 HP  3406/3865 MP  2230/2240 mv  879tnl  
Lv 129  G 82708 | Throne Room (NESW)
>>    The Royal Bedroom (G)
  This bedchamber is filled with the dueling scents of perfume and sweat. 
You look around in amazement at the collection of junk and treasure
obviously beloved by the royalty of this castle.  A ragged moose head hangs
over the dresser, its horns serving as a jewelry rack for various necklaces
and bracelets.  A priceless ebony box holds a collection of common
seashells.  A laundry basket near the bed is filled with soggy
handkerchiefs, and the room is draped in black.  

[ Exits: east ]
The King's Chamberlain is folding laundry here.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3114/3372 HP  3406/3865 MP  2229/2240 mv  879tnl

A Castle Courtyard
  Shouts and clatters fill this yard as guardsmen and knights spar and
joust against one another.  A tilt and a pair of jousting lanes line one
side of the yard, and archery targets are set against one wall.  You hastily
duck as a mace wielded by a by a giant man swings perilously close to your
head.

e
A Stableyard
  You step aside adroitly as a crazed horse charges past you, a small figure in
black clutching onto its back. Looking around, you see many other horses, 
caparisoned and saddled for riding. Several armored men stride into the yard 
and mount up, reaching down to receive their lances from their squires. You 
step aside once more to avoid getting trampled by the mob.

[ Exits: (north) (south) west ]
A chicken pecks in the dirt, looking for dinner.
A chicken pecks in the dirt, looking for dinner.

Lv 129  G 82708 | A Castle Courtyard ([N]ESW)
>>    The Kitchens
  The bustle in this room reminds you of your mother's kitchen...  On acid!
Everywhere around you servants are running, and in the center of the room a
midget stands on a table.  You can tell he is the cook by the large white
hat he wears, and he is screaming out orders to all.  The servants seem used
to this behavior, and wisely ignore him and his contradictory orders.  

[ Exits: (north) east (south) ]
A chef stands on the table directing activities.
A servant is preparing a funeral feast here.

>>    The Midden [**> PK <**]
  The stench rising from this room almost makes you gag as you enter.  A
hasty look around convinces you that you don't want to know what the flies
are investigating in the holes in the ground.  With the state of this room,
you are amazed that the inhabitants of Castle Caraway are still healthy.

>>    The Back Gate [**> PK <**]
  You pass through the back gate of the castle, hastily stepping aside to
avoid being trampled by a squad of knights thundering up the road.  To the
north you can see a tall mountain, from which you can hear occasional
screams.  While you stand here, you can only imagine that whatever tortures
Gilda must be suffering.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) Athlau the Alpha.
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Castle Gates
  Above you loom the great iron gates of Castle Caraway.  Threadbare
banners still snap and wave along the side of the gates, speaking of a
happier day for this benighted realm.  Peasants trudge along this road,
scattering when they see you.  You wonder what great catastrophe could have
struck to make such a peaceful realm into a warzone.  Suddenly, you are
almost run down by a troop of horsemen who are galloping madly away from the
castle.  One of them calls to you as he passes, "Flee, neighbor, while you
can!  A dragon has kidnapped the princess and would ravage all the land!"

>>    Great Hall
  You have entered the foyer of Castle Caraway.  You stop in awe as you
gaze upon the workmanship of this famed castle.  Huge marble blocks carved
with roses form the arching, cathedral-like room. Suits of armor worn by
the heroes of days past line these walls.  Yet, within the peaceful
stillness of the castle, a low hum of dismay can be discerned.  To the north
lies the grand hallway of the castle, while to the south is the castle
entrance.  Doors to the east and west hide further mysteries.

A Long Hallway
  You stand in the grand hall of the Castle of Caraway.  All around you,
courtiers hurry here and there, talking in low whispers.  A chill air lies
upon the castle, as if some great doom had befallen the inhabitants.  A red
velvet carpet runs down the middle of the hall, leading north into the
Throne room, and south into the foyer.  East and west lie lesser hallways.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Golden Aura) A gentle-looking courtier smiles at you.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3372/3372 HP  3835/3865 MP  2227/2240 mv  843tnl

n
Throne Room
  You stand in a large room with huge arching windows.  You pause for a
moment to admire the windows, which are stained glass representations of
roses in glory and unicorns.  Then your eyes are drawn to the head of the
room, where two golden thrones sit.  The courtiers of the court part for you
as you approach the monarchs of this grand castle.  There is an aura of
despair and sorrow that seem to congeal about you almost physically as you
draw nearer the king and queen.  You see that the queen is sobbing quietly
into her handkerchief and the king is grimly talking to several of his
knights.  He sees you and beckons you forward with a glad cry.  

[ Exits: north (east) south (west) ]

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

castle.  One of them calls to you as he passes, "Flee, neighbor, while you
can!  A dragon has kidnapped the princess and would ravage all the land!"

  You begin to wonder if this tunnel will ever end.  You have been all
turned around by the twists and turns, and you peer down another steep
slope, wondering if you can ever find your way home again.  The screams are
growing louder, which is the only thing that convinces you that you are
heading in the right direction.  

[ Exits: south down ]
A vampire bat screeches into the dark caverns.
A hedgehog snuffles in the dust, seeking grubs.

A Dank Cavern
  You can feel a moist heat blowing towards you from the south.  It is
scented with brimstone and ash, and you think that you have maybe come
towards the end of this tunnel at last.  You eagerly stride forward, ready
to face whatever danger you might encounter.  

[ Exits: south up ]
A hedgehog snuffles in the dust, seeking grubs.
A hedgehog snuffles in the dust, seeking grubs.

The End of A Dank Cavern
  At last you have reached the end of the dark, winding tunnel that you
have been climbing through for what feels like hours.  Peering down into the
cavern below, you see that it is lighted fitfully by pools of fire and lava.
You can't make out any details, but you can almost feel the sullen menace of
the dragon.  

[ Exits: north down ]

Brimstone Caves
  You have entered the cave of the dragon.  You look around you and decide
that this could never be your home sweet home.  A blast of heat from a
nearby pool of fire washes over you, and you hastily duck to avoid the hot
ashes that drift your way.

help force bolt


----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Force Bolt'.
Help Category : Attack Spell.
Related Helps : Magic Missile, Lightning Bolt.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-18 21:49:56.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'force bolt' <victim>
Damage: magic
Spell Number: 348

Tapping into raw magical energy, the Mage shapes this chaotic force into
a missile of great intensity, and sends it screaming and spinning into those
who would stand against him.  This spell affects only one opponent.

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

help holy mirror
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'HOLY MIRROR'.
Help Category : Protection.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-31 20:04:26.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'holy mirror'
Spell Number: 255

This spell gives its target resistance to holy and light based attacks
which includes colour spray, moonbeam, prismatic spray and any weapons 
based on light/holy damage.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

>>    WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

>>    Whitewind Avenue (G) (2278)

Phoenix Square (G) (2278)

Whitewind Avenue (G) (2278)

North of the Grand Plaza (G) (2278)

Midgaardian Publishing House Reception Area (G) (2278)

News Stand (G)
  The south side of the reception area is lined with shelves upon
shelves of newspapers, magazines and books from floor to ceiling.  Here you
can pick up reading material on just about any subject you can imagine, and
quite a few that you can't.  Or at least, you would be able to pick them up
if it weren't for the great damned counter in the way.  Judging from the
ancient baroque cash register atop it, you're actually expected to PAY for
the privilege of reading them.  As well as periodicals, the stall seems to
have various other bits and pieces under the glass display counter, some of
which look as though they may be useful.  Other items, you suspect, are
merely random items found lying around the company offices, or scavenged
from the nearby dump, then hastily stamped with the corporate logo and a
price tag affixed.  

[ Exits: north east south down ]
A short man lurks behind the cash register, idly thumbing through a magazine.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2264/3383 HP  1339/3956 MP  2369/2369 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 98264 | News Stand (NESD)
>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>    
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

w
Milo's Research Laboratory
  As you enter the room, the heat overwhelms you, and the clang of metal
on metal is deafening.  Finally Milo stands, and ambles over to close
the door to the forge room.  Finally, you can hear yourself think.
 
Around the room, you see freshly forged weapons and armour.  You look
around, trying to find what you seek.
 
The selection is amazing, and after staring around, in awe, you find
what it is you were looking for, and go on your merry way.
 

[ Exits: east ]
Milo the Chemist stands here waiting to make your search for knowledge easier.

list
Seekers Public Library
  As you enter the room, the smell of ink from the pages tickles
your nose.  Your eyes adjust to the light in the room. Candles
are on every table, giving the room a warm and inviting glow.
Smoke rises from some of the candles to swirl and form a Sign.
 
Comfortable chairs are in the corners, just perfect for curling
up to read the vast tomes of knowledge stored within these walls.
The only sound being heard is the sound of soft whispers and pages
turning.
 
As you stroll around the store and peek at the contents of the
shelves you see such classics as Homer's the Illiad, and the Odyssey,
and the new soon-to-be-classics, from the personal library of Tefnut,
ruler of Alexandria, and cousin of Eurystheus, King of Mycenae.
 
Finally, you find the storekeeper, Imhotep, and ask him for help
finding that rare treasure you came in for.

[ Exits: north ]
Imhotep, vizier and high priest of Ptah stands here.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2432/3303 HP  1649/3956 MP  2449/2529 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 60544 | Seekers Public Library (N)
>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2432/3303 HP  1619/3956 MP  2449/2529 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 60544 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
[AFK] (Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) SpaceJakes is resting here.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Red Aura) Forma not formatted.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2432/3303 HP  1619/3956 MP  2448/2529 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 60544 | The Grand City of Aylor (NESWUD)
>>    Whitewind Avenue (G) (2448)

Phoenix Square (G) (2448)

Whitewind Avenue (G) (2448)

North of the Grand Plaza (G) (2448)

The Grand Plaza (G) (2448)

Meridian Square (G) (2448)

The Grand Plaza (G) (2448)

Among the Philosophes (G) (2448)

The Road Not Taken
  Turning away from the busy street, you walk down a little-used alley and come
to a part of the city that doesn't seem to get a lot of traffic. You marvel at
the sights and sounds as you make your way between the houses and shops. 
Somehow, this area seems even more beautiful than the rest of Aylor. The 
buildings look old, yet you don't remember ever seeing them before. Can there
really be an entire city quarter you just never noticed before?
You make your way through a pair of city gates and out into the countryside.
Breaking away from the main road is a path following along the city wall.
Off in the distance you see a large tower made of three intertwined pillars.
It piques your attention, so you follow the path toward the tower. Eventually,
you come to a road. Though it seems neglected, there is something hauntingly
familiar about it, as if you've seen it in another world. The Granite Highway.

[ Exits: east south west ]
     (Magic) A mahogany sign with directions to the shops and attractions is posted here.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2432/3303 HP  1619/3956 MP  2448/2529 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 60544 | The Road Not Taken (ESW)
>>    
s
w
The Granite Highway
  Traveling along the Granite Highway, you notice a striking marble
staircase leading upwards.  Peering along the glorious blue and white 
marble, you can discern a helixed tower rising above you.  Deciding 
that the scenic route would, perhaps, be better than simply walking 
along the same, tired highway, you veer off the stone road and take 
the path towards the brilliant staircase. Wonders past the imagining 
of mortal beings must reside there, and your head fills with images 
of marble staircases, each landing revealing a new landscape or marvel.
The graceful flight of several white doves draws arcs of tranquility 
along the reddish-orange background of the majestic setting sun.  A 
northerly breeze ruffles your hair and makes the deep green grass sway 
back and forth like the gentle crests and troughs of the Dragon Sea.  
You decide to remove your boots so that your worn feet can bathe in 
the essence of placidity that surrounds you.  Thoughts of a utopian 
society enter your tired head, and you slowly drift off to sleep, 
dreaming of a land where all walk hand in hand towards a brighter future.

[ Exits: north south west (down) ]
     [*] A generic voting booth is here

[*Daily Blessing*] 2432/3303 HP  1619/3956 MP  2447/2529 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 60544 | The Granite Highway (NSW[D])
>>    The Alembic and Pentameter
  This room is dominated by a long counter along one side.  The counter
is made of the same rainbowed marble found elsewhere in the tower,
and appears seamless.  Behind the counter, long rows of shelves line
the walls.  The shelves are packed with bottles, glittering with deeply
jewel-toned potions.  At one end of the counter, a small alembic lies
in a deep wall embrasure.  Written around the arched embrasure are the
processes of alchemy...Calcination, Digestion, Fermentation, Congelation, 
Fixation, Ceration, Distillation, Sublimation, Filtration, Solution, 
Multiplication and Projection.

[ Exits: east west ]
Hermes Trismegistus delves into the mysteries of life itself.

w
Rowdy Ralph's Entertainment Emporium
  The cavernous interior is dark in places and bright in others.  There is 
magic here throughout, with all kinds of affects from colored bands of 
lights to sound dampening walls of silence.  In the center, a giant of a man, 
Ralph Roisterdoister, presides over beer taps.  It is rumored that under the
counter are other types of liquor...or almost anything else one might
desire.  There is a man playing a harp with accompaniment from a dark-haired
woman.  Her voice is captivating, and when she sings, people generally listen.
You head towards the back, where there are several rooms.  It seems Ralph
has branched out into several other trades, having an eatery, shops of many
and various types, gambling dens, and even though it seems out of place, a 
room of meditation.
It seems Ralph runs a clean, honest and fair establishment, and as such it
is packed with people of all sorts, eating, drinking, gambling, talking.
You feel you can do some business here as well as some pleasure.

[ Exits: east south ]
A man is here, peddling goods from the city of Tanelorn.

The Granite Highway
  Traveling along the Granite Highway, you notice a striking marble
staircase leading upwards.  Peering along the glorious blue and white 
marble, you can discern a helixed tower rising above you.  Deciding 
that the scenic route would, perhaps, be better than simply walking 
along the same, tired highway, you veer off the stone road and take 
the path towards the brilliant staircase. Wonders past the imagining 
of mortal beings must reside there, and your head fills with images 
of marble staircases, each landing revealing a new landscape or marvel.
The graceful flight of several white doves draws arcs of tranquility 
along the reddish-orange background of the majestic setting sun.  A 
northerly breeze ruffles your hair and makes the deep green grass sway 
back and forth like the gentle crests and troughs of the Dragon Sea.  
You decide to remove your boots so that your worn feet can bathe in 
the essence of placidity that surrounds you.  Thoughts of a utopian 
society enter your tired head, and you slowly drift off to sleep, 
dreaming of a land where all walk hand in hand towards a brighter future.

[ Exits: north south west (down) ]
     [*] A generic voting booth is here

[*Daily Blessing*] 2689/3363 HP  2075/3916 MP  2487/2489 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 300444 | The Granite Highway (NSW[D])
>>    The Alembic and Pentameter
  This room is dominated by a long counter along one side.  The counter
is made of the same rainbowed marble found elsewhere in the tower,
and appears seamless.  Behind the counter, long rows of shelves line
the walls.  The shelves are packed with bottles, glittering with deeply
jewel-toned potions.  At one end of the counter, a small alembic lies
in a deep wall embrasure.  Written around the arched embrasure are the
processes of alchemy...Calcination, Digestion, Fermentation, Congelation, 
Fixation, Ceration, Distillation, Sublimation, Filtration, Solution, 
Multiplication and Projection.

[ Exits: east west ]
Hermes Trismegistus delves into the mysteries of life itself.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2689/3363 HP  2075/3916 MP  2486/2489 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 300444 | The Alembic and Pentameter (EW)
>>    Rowdy Ralph's Entertainment Emporium
  The cavernous interior is dark in places and bright in others.  There is 
magic here throughout, with all kinds of affects from colored bands of 
lights to sound dampening walls of silence.  In the center, a giant of a man, 
Ralph Roisterdoister, presides over beer taps.  It is rumored that under the
counter are other types of liquor...or almost anything else one might
desire.  There is a man playing a harp with accompaniment from a dark-haired
woman.  Her voice is captivating, and when she sings, people generally listen.
You head towards the back, where there are several rooms.  It seems Ralph
has branched out into several other trades, having an eatery, shops of many
and various types, gambling dens, and even though it seems out of place, a 
room of meditation.
It seems Ralph runs a clean, honest and fair establishment, and as such it
is packed with people of all sorts, eating, drinking, gambling, talking.
You feel you can do some business here as well as some pleasure.

[ Exits: east south ]
A man is here, peddling goods from the city of Tanelorn.

Lv 131  G 278064 | Rowdy Ralph's Entertainment Emporium (ES)
>>    
s
Blacksmith's Shop
  You wander in the smithy, curious as to see the skill level of  the smith.
The smith grunts but does not pause his work, a good sign.  You wouldn't want
someone not paying attention to his work, after all.  There is a display area
with things probably for sale:  the usual weaponry, of course.  Some unique
metals are here to be seen.  One vaguely gold colored one that looks like an
unlikely amalagam of bronze and glass.  Various chains, from heavy chains
that could support a drawbridge to a silver neck-chain with links so small
you have to examine it very closely to make sure it actually is a chain.
In another section of the shop is apparently the repaired items waiting
to be retrieved.  Everything from wagon wheels to doorknobs.  Looking closely,
you can't see where the original was broken.  Indeed, this smith is skilled.
The smith turns to you inquiringly, after motioning an apprentice to
keep working the bellows.  You drag out a prized possession, a mithril-like
chain mail shirt.  It isn't exactly mithril, nor anything else any smith so
far has been able to identify.  Regardless, you show the broken clasp made
by some long ago smith.
The smith nods his acceptance and tells you that he can fix this, better
than the clasp on it now.  You agree on a price and leave, satisfied.

[ Exits: north west ]
     A blunted wooden sword used in training lies here collecting dust.
A towering figure of earth labors resiliently here by a forge.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2817/3413 HP  2310/3996 MP  2259/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 195584 | Rowdy Ralph's Entertainment Emporium (ES)
>>    
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) Athlau the Alpha.
(Player) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Tenebrous the Navigator.
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2817/3413 HP  2280/3996 MP  2259/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 195584 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Xzx walks on black & white; does grey exist?.
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) SpaceJakes is resting here.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Red Aura) Forma not formatted.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2817/3413 HP  2280/3996 MP  2258/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 195584 | The Grand City of Aylor (NESWUD)
>>    Whitewind Avenue (G) (2258)

Entrance to the Crusader Clan Temple (G)
  It takes you only a few seconds to realise that this is no ordinary temple 
building. There is a constant flow in and out of the temple of people and 
goods. As you watch, a shipment of shining white plate armor is carted into 
the temple doors. Not long after, a group of noble knights exit the temple 
accompanied by the blare of trumpets to honor the start of a new crusade 
against evil. You notice a friendly knight standing near the large arch 
leading into the temple who appears to be directing all newcomers to various 
sections of the temple. You are convinced that your stay here will be a 
blessed one.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     A small campfire burns merrily away here.
Cedric leans comfortably against a sign with directions around the temple.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2817/3413 HP  2280/3996 MP  2258/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 195584 | Entrance to the Crusader Clan Temple (NESWUD)
>>    

Your skin feels soft again.

n
The Marble Hallway (G)
  As you look around the hall, you notice the finely crafted walls of white 
marble. Within the patterns of the opaque stone you glimpse images of past 
Crusaders. They seem to be speaking words of truth and wisdom to you. As you 
near the end of the hallway you wonder what strange power dwells in this 
place. Perhaps it is simply a figment of your imagination, brought on by the 
sacred aura that fills these corridors.

Up: Shops
Down: Services

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2963/3413 HP  2494/3996 MP  2228/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 195584 | The Marble Hallway (NESWUD)
>>    
u
The Shadowed Hall
  You have entered the Marketplace.  To your left you notice a 
room full of young knights in search of their first set of equipment.  
To your right stands a tall proud knight offering a more sophisticated list 
of armour.  Straight across the hall ahead of you is another experienced 
knight honing a set of fine weapons.  Perhaps investigating these rooms 
further will allow you to find what you are seeking.

North - Weaponry
East - Armoury
South - Traveling Supplies
West - New Squire's equipment

[ Exits: north east south west down ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 2963/3413 HP  2494/3996 MP  2228/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 195584 | The Shadowed Hall (NESWD)
>>    
n
The Temple Weaponry
  As you step into the Temple Weaponry, you take notice of the remarkable items
displayed before you. The floor is worn and scuffed by the wear of time and 
the many travellers come and gone. Weapons of the finest quality have been 
set on display, while the Weaponry's caretaker Sir William is busy sharpening
another strong blade. Each item has been designed and honed to perfection.
The Crusaders take great care to ensure the quality and holy power of each 
weapon. Sir William pauses in his work and looks over to you with a 
half-hearted smile, then beckons you to look closer at each selection.

[ Exits: south ]
Sir William looks up as you enter the room and politely offers assistance.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3050/3413 HP  2631/3996 MP  2229/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 173204 | The Temple Weaponry (S)
>>    Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) Athlau the Alpha.
(Player) (Hidden) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Tenebrous the Navigator.
(Player) YeeShin NecOccisor.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3050/3413 HP  2601/3996 MP  2229/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 173204 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>    
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Eastern Yvan Park (2228)

Approaching a Vast Complex of Ruins
  Exploring the eastern edges of Yvan Park you discover a vast complex of 
ruins to the north. A massive tree, whose trunk is almost entirely 
covered with tightly wound vines, has long since reclaimed the marble 
of the forgotten temple. The entire locale is now serving as the 
arboreous outpost of the Amazons. Toxophilite, the retired Amazon 
Champion, is surrounded by floating orchid petals as she patiently 
waits for travellers seeking her guidance.

[ Exits: north west ]
Peaceful Toxophilite is prepared for training & guidance.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3085/3413 HP  2669/3996 MP  2229/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 173204 | Approaching a Vast Complex of Ruins (NW)
>>    An Overgrown Temple
  
Upon entering the ruined complex, you find yourself surrounded by a 
surprising array of flora and fauna. To the east you see a brightly 
lit room and hear the sound of hammerfalls echoing from within. To the west 
you spot a crumbling doorway with the words, "Hall of Ancestors" engraven 
above it. At the back of the chamber, you see a grand spiralling staircase
with a myriad of ancestral spirits perched upon its treds.

>>    
e
Chamber of Darkness
  You find yourself inside a darkened chamber that has been fashioned 
out of the hollow tree. Crumbling stones can be seen within the 
wooden walls of the chamber, having long since been partially absorbed by 
the cyclopean timber. Despite the darkness, you discern a woven ladder 
leading to top of the chamber with a sign beside it stating, "The Shop 
Above the Canopy." On the back wall, there is a braided wooden 
basket suspended from thick vines.

[ Exits: east west up ]
     (Magic) This tooth came from a wolf; it is very sharp!

Lv 131  G 173204 | Chamber of Darkness (EWU)
>>    
e
s
Past the Northern Gate
  Walking through the gates you look about you and see mostly thatch huts and 
training fields. The amazons go about their daily routine. You see several 
of the veteran warriors working with the trainees, schooling them in the ways
of combat just off to the south. To the west you hear a loud noise coming 
from the nearest of the huts. You are about to go investigate when an old 
woman comes up to you and introduces herself as Miranda. "Welcome to the 
proving grounds of The Tribes, care to test yourself in the traditional ways 
of the Amazon? Let's see....what creature that has been plaguing us can I 
have you slay?" says Miranda with a twinkle in her eye. 

[ Exits: east south west (up) down ]
     (Magic) This salty cod of Svrogan's own recipe has a special kick.
     (Magic) (Glow) A tiger's eye jewel is laying on the floor.
     (Magic) (Glow) A thick glass vial full of clear liquid rests on the ground.
( 4) (Magic) A little stone chip lies here.
     (Magic) Miranda's Jug of her special Sweetmix is on the floor next to her.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (White Aura) (OPK) Haagen Hanafukubi.
Miranda, the Amazon Wise, awaits patiently by the village fountain.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3130/3413 HP  2753/3996 MP  2226/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 173204 | Past the Northern Gate (ESW[U]D)
>>    The Training Circle (G)
  As you head on further south through the encampment you come across the 
training fields of The Tribes. You see many of the Amazon practicing 
drills with weapons, combat formations and general physical to some new 
trainees. "You, there, what is your name?" She shouts. A muscular wolfen 
answers "Kallendbor M'am." "Attack me Kallendbor...NOW!" Shouts Lessandra.
Kallendbor leaps into the air with a ferocious strike that would rip a man in
half but Lessandra easily sidesteps and sends him spinning with one fluid 
motion. "You see students, it's not the size of your opponent that really 
matters, but what his current position own force against him. All because I 
knew where to move and more importantly how to move my opponent. Now go and 
do your daily line drills." Lessandra lectures. She then turns her gaze 
towards you and asks "How may I help you?" 

[ Exits: north south west ]
     (Magic) This fur is soft and hairy.
     It's just a dented can with some goo inside.
Lessandra, Amazon Champion, is here teaching the day's lesson.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3130/3413 HP  2753/3996 MP  2225/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 173204 | The Training Circle (NSW)
>>    
w
The Kayapos Trading Grounds
  West of the training fields you come to a large clearing that is strewn 
about with goods. Some look as though they have been plundered from other 
cultures outside of the Jungle, while some appear to be of Amazonian make.
This is where the Kayapos tribe brings goods for trade with the rest of the 
Tribes of Amazon. Shilo Enupe alKayapo seems to be the one in charge here, 
directing her subordinates to make sure all goods are traded fairly and 
quickly. Further west you see a small hut where many of the other Kayapos 
enter with members of other tribes. 

[ Exits: east west ]
Shilo the Amazon Trader is dusting off the shelves.

The Kayapos Trading Grounds
  West of the training fields you come to a large clearing that is strewn 
about with goods. Some look as though they have been plundered from other 
cultures outside of the Jungle, while some appear to be of Amazonian make.
This is where the Kayapos tribe brings goods for trade with the rest of the 
Tribes of Amazon. Shilo Enupe alKayapo seems to be the one in charge here, 
directing her subordinates to make sure all goods are traded fairly and 
quickly. Further west you see a small hut where many of the other Kayapos 
enter with members of other tribes. 

[ Exits: east west ]
Shilo the Amazon Trader is dusting off the shelves.

list
The Yanomami Circle of Harmony
  This great circle is where all the Tribes of the Amazon meet to settle 
disputes and agree upon mandates that affect their people as a whole. There 
are logs set out for sitting in an amphitheater style, fanning out from the 
western half of the circle. Anyone who wishes to speak may do so, as long as
they do it with respect and wait their turn. The Yanomami mediators maintain 
the circle, as well as conduct the rites and rituals of the Amazons that keep
them bonded as a people. 

[ Exits: east down ]
     [*] A stone tablet rests here waiting for you to cast your vote.

d
Beneath the Circle of Harmony
  The entrance to this cavern is cleverly hidden beneath a stone in the 
circle of harmony. Here, the Kayapos bring their greatest creations, 
reserved for only the most elite of amazon warriors in all the tribes.
Toarasha, the greatest witchwoman the tribes have ever known, resides here.
Her unique talents are used day and night to place protective enchantments 
upon the artifacts, so that the amazons will be even more terrible and great 
in battle against the enemies of the jungle. 

[ Exits: up ]
A short woman covered in tribal paint and feathers is here.

Shop Above the Canopy
  Drawn inside by the hammerfalls that resound throughout the outpost, you

marvels from a myriad of organic materials. Little remains of the temple in

intact and has been repurposed by Isocrateia into an anvil of nearly 
cyclopean scale.

Chamber of Darkness
  You find yourself inside a darkened chamber that has been fashioned 
out of the hollow tree. Crumbling stones can be seen within the 
wooden walls of the chamber, having long since been partially absorbed by 
the cyclopean timber. Despite the darkness, you discern a woven ladder 
leading to top of the chamber with a sign beside it stating, "The Shop 
Above the Canopy." On the back wall, there is a braided wooden 
basket suspended from thick vines.

An Overgrown Temple
  
Upon entering the ruined complex, you find yourself surrounded by a 
surprising array of flora and fauna. To the east you see a brightly 
lit room and hear the sound of hammerfalls echoing from within. To the west 
you spot a crumbling doorway with the words, "Hall of Ancestors" engraven 
above it. At the back of the chamber, you see a grand spiralling staircase
with a myriad of ancestral spirits perched upon its treds.

[ Exits: east south west up (down) ]

Approaching a Vast Complex of Ruins
  Exploring the eastern edges of Yvan Park you discover a vast complex of 
ruins to the north. A massive tree, whose trunk is almost entirely 
covered with tightly wound vines, has long since reclaimed the marble 
of the forgotten temple. The entire locale is now serving as the 
arboreous outpost of the Amazons. Toxophilite, the retired Amazon 
Champion, is surrounded by floating orchid petals as she patiently 
waits for travellers seeking her guidance.

Past the Northern Gate
  Walking through the gates you look about you and see mostly thatch huts and 
training fields. The amazons go about their daily routine. You see several 
of the veteran warriors working with the trainees, schooling them in the ways
of combat just off to the south. To the west you hear a loud noise coming 
from the nearest of the huts. You are about to go investigate when an old 
woman comes up to you and introduces herself as Miranda. "Welcome to the 
proving grounds of The Tribes, care to test yourself in the traditional ways 
of the Amazon? Let's see....what creature that has been plaguing us can I 
have you slay?" says Miranda with a twinkle in her eye. 

[ Exits: east south west (up) down ]

     (Magic) (Glow) A tiger's eye jewel is laying on the floor.
     (Magic) (Glow) A thick glass vial full of clear liquid rests on the ground.

The Training Circle (G)
  As you head on further south through the encampment you come across the 
training fields of The Tribes. You see many of the Amazon practicing 
drills with weapons, combat formations and general physical to some new 
trainees. "You, there, what is your name?" She shouts. A muscular wolfen 
answers "Kallendbor M'am." "Attack me Kallendbor...NOW!" Shouts Lessandra.
Kallendbor leaps into the air with a ferocious strike that would rip a man in
half but Lessandra easily sidesteps and sends him spinning with one fluid 
motion. "You see students, it's not the size of your opponent that really 
matters, but what his current position own force against him. All because I 
knew where to move and more importantly how to move my opponent. Now go and 
do your daily line drills." Lessandra lectures. She then turns her gaze 
towards you and asks "How may I help you?" 

[ Exits: north south west ]
     (Magic) This fur is soft and hairy.
     It's just a dented can with some goo inside.
Lessandra, Amazon Champion, is here teaching the day's lesson.

Lv 131  G 173204 | The Kayapos Trading Grounds (EW)
e
>>    
The Training Circle (G)
  As you head on further south through the encampment you come across the 
training fields of The Tribes. You see many of the Amazon practicing 
drills with weapons, combat formations and general physical to some new 
trainees. "You, there, what is your name?" She shouts. A muscular wolfen 
answers "Kallendbor M'am." "Attack me Kallendbor...NOW!" Shouts Lessandra.
Kallendbor leaps into the air with a ferocious strike that would rip a man in
half but Lessandra easily sidesteps and sends him spinning with one fluid 
motion. "You see students, it's not the size of your opponent that really 
matters, but what his current position own force against him. All because I 
knew where to move and more importantly how to move my opponent. Now go and 
do your daily line drills." Lessandra lectures. She then turns her gaze 
towards you and asks "How may I help you?" 

[ Exits: north south west ]
     (Magic) This fur is soft and hairy.
     It's just a dented can with some goo inside.
Lessandra, Amazon Champion, is here teaching the day's lesson.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3224/3413 HP  2073/3996 MP  2221/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 173204 | The Training Circle (NSW)
w
>>    
The Kayapos Trading Grounds
  West of the training fields you come to a large clearing that is strewn 
about with goods. Some look as though they have been plundered from other 
cultures outside of the Jungle, while some appear to be of Amazonian make.
This is where the Kayapos tribe brings goods for trade with the rest of the 
Tribes of Amazon. Shilo Enupe alKayapo seems to be the one in charge here, 
directing her subordinates to make sure all goods are traded fairly and 
quickly. Further west you see a small hut where many of the other Kayapos 
enter with members of other tribes. 

[ Exits: east west ]
Shilo the Amazon Trader is dusting off the shelves.

The Training Circle (G)
  As you head on further south through the encampment you come across the 
training fields of The Tribes. You see many of the Amazon practicing 
drills with weapons, combat formations and general physical to some new 
trainees. "You, there, what is your name?" She shouts. A muscular wolfen 
answers "Kallendbor M'am." "Attack me Kallendbor...NOW!" Shouts Lessandra.
Kallendbor leaps into the air with a ferocious strike that would rip a man in
half but Lessandra easily sidesteps and sends him spinning with one fluid 
motion. "You see students, it's not the size of your opponent that really 
matters, but what his current position own force against him. All because I 
knew where to move and more importantly how to move my opponent. Now go and 
do your daily line drills." Lessandra lectures. She then turns her gaze 
towards you and asks "How may I help you?"

[*Daily Blessing*] 3257/3413 HP  2027/3996 MP  2229/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 173204 | The Training Circle (NSW)
>>    
w
w
The Kayapos Trading Grounds
  West of the training fields you come to a large clearing that is strewn 
about with goods. Some look as though they have been plundered from other 
cultures outside of the Jungle, while some appear to be of Amazonian make.
This is where the Kayapos tribe brings goods for trade with the rest of the 
Tribes of Amazon. Shilo Enupe alKayapo seems to be the one in charge here, 
directing her subordinates to make sure all goods are traded fairly and 
quickly. Further west you see a small hut where many of the other Kayapos 
enter with members of other tribes. 

[ Exits: east west ]
Shilo the Amazon Trader is dusting off the shelves.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3257/3413 HP  2027/3996 MP  2229/2229 mv  897tnl

  West of the training fields you come to a large clearing that is strewn 
about with goods. Some look as though they have been plundered from other

[*Daily Blessing*] 3257/3413 HP  2027/3996 MP  2229/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 173204 | The Kayapos Hut (EW)
>>    The Yanomami Circle of Harmony
  This great circle is where all the Tribes of the Amazon meet to settle 
disputes and agree upon mandates that affect their people as a whole. There 
are logs set out for sitting in an amphitheater style, fanning out from the 
western half of the circle. Anyone who wishes to speak may do so, as long as
they do it with respect and wait their turn. The Yanomami mediators maintain 
the circle, as well as conduct the rites and rituals of the Amazons that keep
them bonded as a people. 

[ Exits: east down ]
     [*] A stone tablet rests here waiting for you to cast your vote.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3257/3413 HP  2027/3996 MP  2229/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 173204 | The Yanomami Circle of Harmony (ED)
>>    
d
Beneath the Circle of Harmony
  The entrance to this cavern is cleverly hidden beneath a stone in the 
circle of harmony. Here, the Kayapos bring their greatest creations, 
reserved for only the most elite of amazon warriors in all the tribes.
Toarasha, the greatest witchwoman the tribes have ever known, resides here.
Her unique talents are used day and night to place protective enchantments 
upon the artifacts, so that the amazons will be even more terrible and great 
in battle against the enemies of the jungle. 

[ Exits: up ]
A short woman covered in tribal paint and feathers is here.

n
l;ex
Past the Northern Gate
  Walking through the gates you look about you and see mostly thatch huts and 
training fields. The amazons go about their daily routine. You see several 
of the veteran warriors working with the trainees, schooling them in the ways
of combat just off to the south. To the west you hear a loud noise coming 
from the nearest of the huts. You are about to go investigate when an old 
woman comes up to you and introduces herself as Miranda. "Welcome to the 
proving grounds of The Tribes, care to test yourself in the traditional ways 
of the Amazon? Let's see....what creature that has been plaguing us can I 
have you slay?" says Miranda with a twinkle in her eye. 

[ Exits: east south west (up) down ]
     (Magic) This salty cod of Svrogan's own recipe has a special kick.
     (Magic) (Glow) A tiger's eye jewel is laying on the floor.
     (Magic) (Glow) A thick glass vial full of clear liquid rests on the ground.
( 4) (Magic) A little stone chip lies here.
     (Magic) Miranda's Jug of her special Sweetmix is on the floor next to her.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (White Aura) (OPK) Haagen Hanafukubi.
Miranda, the Amazon Wise, awaits patiently by the village fountain.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3301/3413 HP  2109/3996 MP  2229/2229 mv  897tnl

Lv 131  G 173204 | Past the Northern Gate (ESW[U]D)

e
A Tranquil, Sylvan Glade
  After chatting with Miranda you decide to investigate
the noises that were coming from the hut to the west.  Stepping
inside you find yourself within the WitchWoman Toarasha's
medicine hut.  She has several ritual components strewn about
the hut and the smell of burning healing ointment is prevalent.
Several blankets have been laid out in a specific pattern on the
floor in order to help the wounded receive the spirits of healing
into their bodies.          

[ Exits: west ]
     (Magic) This feather is bright red, it came out of a wing of a songbird.
     (Magic) The blankets seem very inviting to the weary warrior.
     A small campfire burns merrily away here.
A womanly figure is here, huddled under another pile of blankets.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3301/3413 HP  2109/3996 MP  2228/2229 mv  897tnl  
Lv 131  G 173204 | A Tranquil, Sylvan Glade (W)

l;ex
Past the Northern Gate
  Walking through the gates you look about you and see mostly thatch huts and 
training fields. The amazons go about their daily routine. You see several 
of the veteran warriors working with the trainees, schooling them in the ways
of combat just off to the south. To the west you hear a loud noise coming 
from the nearest of the huts. You are about to go investigate when an old 
woman comes up to you and introduces herself as Miranda. "Welcome to the 
proving grounds of The Tribes, care to test yourself in the traditional ways 
of the Amazon? Let's see....what creature that has been plaguing us can I 
have you slay?" says Miranda with a twinkle in her eye. 

[ Exits: east south west (up) down ]
     (Magic) This salty cod of Svrogan's own recipe has a special kick.
     (Magic) (Glow) A tiger's eye jewel is laying on the floor.
     (Magic) (Glow) A thick glass vial full of clear liquid rests on the ground.
( 4) (Magic) A little stone chip lies here.
     (Magic) Miranda's Jug of her special Sweetmix is on the floor next to her.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (White Aura) (OPK) Haagen Hanafukubi.
Miranda, the Amazon Wise, awaits patiently by the village fountain.

w
Chamber of Darkness
  You find yourself inside a darkened chamber that has been fashioned 
out of the hollow tree. Crumbling stones can be seen within the 
wooden walls of the chamber, having long since been partially absorbed by 
the cyclopean timber. Despite the darkness, you discern a woven ladder 
leading to top of the chamber with a sign beside it stating, "The Shop 
Above the Canopy." On the back wall, there is a braided wooden 
basket suspended from thick vines.

[ Exits: east west up ]
     (Magic) This tooth came from a wolf; it is very sharp!
