white stone.  Small candles are mounted on the walls, closely spaced in an
accurate line, providing an artistic play of light and small shadows.  A
narrow red carpet is stretched along the center of the hallway, leading
east.  

[ Exits: north east south ]
(Red Aura) A zombie guard raises an eyebrow at you.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  2019/2054 mv  881tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 106406 | A light hallway (NES)
>>    Naynad's Room
  The room of the professor of necromancy looks like absolutely contrary to
what you could have expected to see.  There are no books or handwritings, no
lecture notes or anything, just some zombie parts lying around the room. 
The professor himself is lying on the bed, occasionally waving his wand, and
then something on the floor explodes.  Now you realize the fun of being a
necromancer - at least you can have a nice stress relief with just a wave of
the hand!  

[ Exits: north ]
(Red Aura) Naynad the Professor of Necromancy is preparing his lecture.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  2013/2054 mv  881tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 106406 | A bend in the hallway (NE)
>>    
n
The Room of the Pentagram
  Immense magical powers fill this room, making the air nearly pulse with 
energy. A huge pentagram has been painted in blood on the floor. From the way
it gleams in the light, the blood appears very fresh. A goblet filled with 
the blood also stands in each vertex of the pentagram. Magical candles 
surround the pentagram, and magic rays of light shoot out at times from 
candle to candle. In the center of the pentagram stands a mighty 
necromancer, accumulating the energy produced by the magical sign. Perhaps 
it is not a good idea to wait around and find out what this energy will be 
used for!

[ Exits: south ]
     (Magic) A long wand charged with magical forces is ready to be used. [4/4]
(Red Aura) An old mage stands here, assisting the head necromancer in his evil deeds.
(Red Aura) (White Aura) The head necromancer stands in the middle of the pentagram, his hands spread
wide.

all around, and spot some movement near the walls.  A chilling breath of
wind flies in from the south, placing fright deep into your soul...

A dark hallway in the Necromancers' Guild
  Following the corridor in the guild, you stumble upon an interesting

wandering, crawling, sitting around the room.  Taking a closer look, you

experiments.  Classrooms should be nearby.

the east.  You wonder what is going on around here.

You step into a portal and arrive in...
An old grave
  You never thought graves would be made this large.  The walls are
enforced by stone slabs covered with claw scratches.  You realize that
unless you will be able to lift the grave stone once more, you will share
the fate of clawing at the grave walls.  You sense a smell of rotting flesh,
while you have not met any indication of recent funerals so far...  You
wonder how this could have happened.

The Room of the Pentagram
  Immense magical powers fill this room, making the air nearly pulse with 
energy. A huge pentagram has been painted in blood on the floor. From the way
it gleams in the light, the blood appears very fresh. A goblet filled with 
the blood also stands in each vertex of the pentagram. Magical candles 
surround the pentagram, and magic rays of light shoot out at times from 
candle to candle. In the center of the pentagram stands a mighty 
necromancer, accumulating the energy produced by the magical sign. Perhaps 
it is not a good idea to wait around and find out what this energy will be 
used for!

  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that

dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.

help Solidify
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Solidify.
Help Category : Equipment.
Related Helps : Detect invis, Illuminate, Resonate, Disenchant.
Last Updated  : 2015-12-19 17:53:22.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax: cast 'solidify' <item>

High level mages and psionicists are able to manipulate the molecular
structure of items they are carrying to make them more compact. The result
of this spell is that items previously invisible can now be seen by the
average eye.

An extremely lucky caster has a small chance of adding hitroll or damroll
to the item they solidify.  Once this happens, the solidified flag is added
to the item and it is not possible to cast solidify upon it again.  Items
must be wearable in a specific position (e.g., 'take hold', 'take waist')
in order to receive stats from this spell.  Items with only 'Wearable:
take' will not receive stats from this spell.

Primary stat: Intelligence, Wisdom.
Affected by : Luck.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

                     Goal information for: Deathtrap Dungeon 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The Overlord has imprisoned his nation in a dungeon. Alimnar is looking for 
someone powerful enough to overthrow the Overlord and free the people from
the dungeon before it becomes a deathtrap.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Difficulty       : Medium              
Recommended Level: 120
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You have not yet unlocked any of the tasks in this quest.

goals 131

                     Goal information for: Intrigues of Times Past 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Family Balmtor, once a strong and noble family, lost their status and power
due to an argument, many years ago. With the "sudden" death of the late
king Victor, fingers are being pointed everywhere and at everyone. And
while there are those who seem pleased with the new management, some stand
to lose their lives because of it. Can you solve the murder of the late
king and reinstate family Balmtor as nobility?

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Difficulty       : Medium              
Recommended Level: 195
Minimum Level    : 150
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You have not yet unlocked any of the tasks in this quest.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Uncharted Oceans

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  4056/4086 MP  1983/2054 mv  881tnl (Reply: Talbor)

------------------------------------------------------------
You step inside the fog and find yourself elsewhere.
------------------------------------------------------------
Beachside landing
  Waves gently lap at the glimmering sands here, creating a calming rhythmic 
hum in your ears. Just off the shallow waters you see a group of ships, 
seamen tirelessly unloading supplies. Inland a short distance, you spot a 
makeshift camp positioned just before a towering forest. A dim rainbow arcs 
up in front of the camp like an entryway.

[ Exits: north east west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  4056/4086 MP  1982/2054 mv  881tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 106406 | Beachside landing (NEW)

(Friend) Gorsk: 'i wonder what they'll do with the seanchan. cause i don't see amazon casting black

n
A sprawling beach
  The beach seems to stretch to the horizon to either side of you, yet has an 
unnerving feel of going nowhere. The sun's rays warm the opalescent sands 
beneath your feet. As the light plays with the tiny grains, they reflect 
marvelous colors back into the air. The campsite up ahead stands in stark 
contrast to the radiance of the sands. As rays of light dance off the sands, 
they cast an iridescent wreath around the camp.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
An ancient fog rolls lazily along, obscuring vision from the outside world.

goals logging

                     Goal information for: Svrogan's Logging Camp 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
As warfare and strife spread across Andolor, the demand of sturdy lumber has 
outpaced the supply. That is, until Svrogan ventured into the uncharted isle
of the Ironwoods. Help him and his band of lumberjacks establish a logging 
camp, and witness the waking of the long-lost Ironwood Forest!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Difficulty       : Medium              
Recommended Level: 100
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You have not yet unlocked any of the tasks in this quest.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Before a settlement (2052)

Within the logging camp
  Sawdust fills the air, creating a thick dust that blankets everything in 
sight. The logging camp is purely utilitarian, with large open-air machinery 
lining the main street. A row of cottages is being constructed just off the 
square. Tireless lumberjacks haul trees in from the forest to the north.

[ Exits: north south west ]
A towering and gruff lumberjack is here, directing progress in the camp.
Svrogan exclaims, "Oy, you there!"

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  2051/2054 mv  881tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 106406 | Within the logging camp (NSW)
>>    

Svrogan beckons for everyone to follow.

Svrogan says, "Y' look to have a sturdy backbone. If'n yah care to 'elp me
 get this'n 'ere camp rollin, I be cuttin' y' in for the reward."
Svrogan chuckles politely.

Svrogan says, "Well, just'n give me a nod if'n y' want in."

nod Svrogan
You nod at Svrogan.
Svrogan exclaims, "Aha! Knew it'n when I seen y' comin'!"
 
Svrogan grins evilly.

   Type 'goals logging' for full details on this goal.

** Task Added : Breaking new ground
 
Svrogan exclaims, "Y' kin start'n by findin' the whirly bit's for'n this
 thar mill. Bit offa rough landin' wit da waves'n all! Back to th' sands
 wit y'!"
 
** Task Added : Recover the saw blades
You receive A Rusty shovel from Svrogan.
Svrogan says, "If'n y need a new shov'l, just be ask'n for one."

tasks here

       Logging : Set up camp in the Ironwoods
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Breaking new ground

Svrogan has asked for your help in establishing his logging camp. Proceed 
with care though, as these are uncharted woods.

Task 2  : Recover the saw blades

Svrogan has asked for you to find the "whirly bits" for his mill. Perhaps you
should go to the beach and dig in the sand for some supplies. Make sure you 
have something to dig with. Let Svrogan know if you need a new shovel!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

"run 2s"
run 2s
Before a settlement (2053)

A sprawling beach
  The beach seems to stretch to the horizon to either side of you, yet has an 
unnerving feel of going nowhere. The sun's rays warm the opalescent sands 
beneath your feet. As the light plays with the tiny grains, they reflect 
marvelous colors back into the air. The campsite up ahead stands in stark 
contrast to the radiance of the sands. As rays of light dance off the sands, 
they cast an iridescent wreath around the camp.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
An ancient fog rolls lazily along, obscuring vision from the outside world.

>>    Svrogren's saw mill
  A flat clearing lies before you. In the middle of it stands a massive saw 
mill, spewing sawdust as it tirelessly spins through massive trees. This must
be the heart of the logging operation, and as soon as lumberjacks return to 
camp with a harvest, they drop it with the burly operator here before heading
back out to the woods. He mills log after log, turning even the most massive 
of trees into manageable planks of useable lumber.

n
Into the forest
  As you move further into the forest, an eerie silence fills the air. While 
the chirp of birds and chatter of critters permeated the edge of the forest, 
they remain only faint memories in your ears here. The rhythmic swings of a 
lumberjack's axe are met with the ringing of iron as though it was a 
blacksmith's hammer on an anvil.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A mighty ironwood rustles happily here, deftly dodging the lumberjacks' chops.

| Keywords   : entwined souls forever damned metal girder         |
| Name       : Entwined Souls of the Forever Damned               |
| Id         : 2899340960                                         |
| Type       : Armor                     Level  :    91           |
| Worth      : 0                         Weight :    12           |
| Wearable   : waist                                              |
| Score      : 120                                                |
| Material   : metal                                              |
| Flags      : invis, magic, burn-proof, V3                       |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------+
| Stat Mods  : Damage roll  : +9       Hit roll     : +1          |
|              Constitution : +6       Dexterity    : +1          |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------+

n
Before a settlement
  Towering beams frame the entrance to the logging camp. The tall wooden walls 
only barely dampen the sound of buzzing and whirring blades beyond. The 
rainbows that outlined the entryway have scattered now that you are closer.
Without the colorful distraction, the walls glisten with their own almost 
metallic character.

[ Exits: north south ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3307/3413 HP  3775/4086 MP  2182/2184 mv  881tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 106579 | Before a settlement (NS)
n
>>    
Within the logging camp
  Sawdust fills the air, creating a thick dust that blankets everything in 
sight. The logging camp is purely utilitarian, with large open-air machinery 
lining the main street. A row of cottages is being constructed just off the 
square. Tireless lumberjacks haul trees in from the forest to the north.

[ Exits: north south west ]
A towering and gruff lumberjack is here, directing progress in the camp.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3307/3413 HP  3775/4086 MP  2181/2184 mv  881tnl (Reply: Talbor)

 git dis mill goin."

You hear some banging, knocking and a few loud crashes and cursing from the clearing to the west.

Then, as clattering dies down, you hear the sound of whirling machinery and Svrogan returns with a
huge smile on his face.
Svrogan says, "Yev dun eet! Me mill be back to whilin' and cuttin... when
 y' be want'n to do more, ask me wut y' can do next."

Outside of Svrogan's camp
  Stepping out of the logging camp, a calming silence falls over you. There is 
a sense of serenity about the hills, and as far as the eye can see lies a 
dense forest. As the sunlight peeks through the heavy canopy above, you see 
an occasional glimmer of axe and sawblade.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3413/3413 HP  4086/4086 MP  2183/2184 mv  881tnl (Reply: Talbor)

Into the forest
  As you move further into the forest, an eerie silence fills the air. While 
the chirp of birds and chatter of critters permeated the edge of the forest, 
they remain only faint memories in your ears here. The rhythmic swings of a 
lumberjack's axe are met with the ringing of iron as though it was a 
blacksmith's hammer on an anvil.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Deeper into the ironwoods
  Deeper into the ironwood forest, the pinging and chopping of axes are but a 
memory ringing through your head. The moaning of the trees has intensified to
take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close 
in on your path, and despite the lack of wind you are certain you see the 
rustling of leaves. In the corner of your eye, a tree stretches luxuriously, 
as if waking from a long slumber.

n
An intersection in the ironwoods
  Barely audible, the ringing of axes upon the ironwood trees is but a 
distraction here. The air is still in this dense thicket, and yet there 
remains an eerie howl amidst the trees. Before you, the trees become too 
dense to pass. In either direction you see a narrow path onward, through the 
ironwood.

[ Exits: north east south ]
     A plate of food sits here, steaming hot.

n
Lost in the ironwoods
  The ironwood trees crowd the path here, and the ringing of distant axeblades 
seems to reverberate all around you. In all directions the mighty metallic 
trunks offer no clue as to which way to continue. Pressing forward may take 
you deeper into the forest, although you cannot be certain you haven't 
doubled back on your starting position.

n
Deep in the ironwoods
  Deeper into the ironwood forest, the pinging and chopping of axes are but a 
memory ringing through your head. The moaning of the trees has intensified to
take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close 
in on your path, and despite the lack of wind you are certain you see the 
rustling of leaves. In the corner of your eye, a tree stretches luxuriously, 
as if waking from a long slumber.

[ Exits: north south ]

n
Edge of an ancient forest
  Standing at the edge of the forest, trees tower over you. As bark twists and 
covers massive trunks, it creates fissures that reveal a heart of iron within
the wood. An occasional woodland critter scurries indifferently up the 
iron-wood behemoths, stopping to stare back at you only momentarily.

[ Exits: east ]

take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close 
in on your path, and despite the lack of wind you are certain you see the 
rustling of leaves. In the corner of your eye, a tree stretches luxuriously, 
as if waking from a long slumber.

[ Exits: north west ]

>>    Meandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf
floats to the ground slowly before you without hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind 
after all.

Lost in the ironwoods
  The ironwood trees crowd the path here, and the ringing of distant axeblades 
seems to reverberate all around you. In all directions the mighty metallic 
trunks offer no clue as to which way to continue. Pressing forward may take 
you deeper into the forest, although you cannot be certain you haven't 
doubled back on your starting position.

ironwood.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

>>    Recreation Room (G)

and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of

around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Beachside landing
  Waves gently lap at the glimmering sands here, creating a calming rhythmic 
hum in your ears. Just off the shallow waters you see a group of ships, 
seamen tirelessly unloading supplies. Inland a short distance, you spot a 
makeshift camp positioned just before a towering forest. A dim rainbow arcs 
up in front of the camp like an entryway.

[ Exits: north east west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3358/3478 HP  3915/4086 MP  1980/2054 mv  881tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 110722 | Beachside landing (NEW)
>>    
n
n
A sprawling beach
  The beach seems to stretch to the horizon to either side of you, yet has an 
unnerving feel of going nowhere. The sun's rays warm the opalescent sands 
beneath your feet. As the light plays with the tiny grains, they reflect 
marvelous colors back into the air. The campsite up ahead stands in stark 
contrast to the radiance of the sands. As rays of light dance off the sands, 
they cast an iridescent wreath around the camp.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
An ancient fog rolls lazily along, obscuring vision from the outside world.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3358/3478 HP  3915/4086 MP  1978/2054 mv  881tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 110722 | A sprawling beach (NESW)
>>    Before a settlement
  Towering beams frame the entrance to the logging camp. The tall wooden walls 
only barely dampen the sound of buzzing and whirring blades beyond. The 
rainbows that outlined the entryway have scattered now that you are closer.
Without the colorful distraction, the walls glisten with their own almost 
metallic character.

[ Exits: north south ]

n
Within the logging camp
  Sawdust fills the air, creating a thick dust that blankets everything in 
sight. The logging camp is purely utilitarian, with large open-air machinery 
lining the main street. A row of cottages is being constructed just off the 
square. Tireless lumberjacks haul trees in from the forest to the north.

[ Exits: north south west ]
A towering and gruff lumberjack is here, directing progress in the camp.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3358/3478 HP  3915/4086 MP  1975/2054 mv  881tnl (Reply: Talbor)

>>    Outside of Svrogan's camp
  Stepping out of the logging camp, a calming silence falls over you. There is 
a sense of serenity about the hills, and as far as the eye can see lies a 
dense forest. As the sunlight peeks through the heavy canopy above, you see 
an occasional glimmer of axe and sawblade.

n
Into the forest
  As you move further into the forest, an eerie silence fills the air. While 
the chirp of birds and chatter of critters permeated the edge of the forest, 
they remain only faint memories in your ears here. The rhythmic swings of a 
lumberjack's axe are met with the ringing of iron as though it was a 
blacksmith's hammer on an anvil.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A mighty ironwood rustles happily here, deftly dodging the lumberjacks' chops.

n
Deeper into the ironwoods
  Deeper into the ironwood forest, the pinging and chopping of axes are but a 
memory ringing through your head. The moaning of the trees has intensified to
take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close 
in on your path, and despite the lack of wind you are certain you see the 
rustling of leaves. In the corner of your eye, a tree stretches luxuriously, 
as if waking from a long slumber.

[ Exits: north south ]

Lv 131  G 110722 | Deeper into the ironwoods (NS)

n
n
An intersection in the ironwoods
  Barely audible, the ringing of axes upon the ironwood trees is but a 
distraction here. The air is still in this dense thicket, and yet there 
remains an eerie howl amidst the trees. Before you, the trees become too 
dense to pass. In either direction you see a narrow path onward, through the 
ironwood.

[ Exits: north east south ]
     A plate of food sits here, steaming hot.
     (Magic) There appears to be the blood of an unfortunate lumberjack on this boken handle.
(Wounded) (Golden Aura) A large Ironwood is murmuring to its bretheren here.

Lv 131  G 110722 | An intersection in the ironwoods (NES)
>>    Lost in the ironwoods
  The ironwood trees crowd the path here, and the ringing of distant axeblades 
seems to reverberate all around you. In all directions the mighty metallic 
trunks offer no clue as to which way to continue. Pressing forward may take 
you deeper into the forest, although you cannot be certain you haven't 
doubled back on your starting position.

[ Exits: north south ]

Into the forest (2053)

Within the logging camp (2049)

Svrogren's saw mill
  A flat clearing lies before you. In the middle of it stands a massive saw 
mill, spewing sawdust as it tirelessly spins through massive trees. This must
be the heart of the logging operation, and as soon as lumberjacks return to 
camp with a harvest, they drop it with the burly operator here before heading
back out to the woods. He mills log after log, turning even the most massive 
of trees into manageable planks of useable lumber.

[ Exits: east ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) Sparks fly from the mill as whirling blades saw through ironwood lumber.
This stout lumberjack is here to help you operate the saw mill safely.

Wandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear 
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf 
floats to the ground before you without a hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind after 
all.

Wandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf 
floats to the ground slowly before you without hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind 
after all.

n
At an impasse
  The ironwood trees here have grown too thick to proceed. The trunks have 
grown so near each other as to create a formidable wall. The ring of an axe 
is but a distance sound in this corner of the forest. In its absence the 
eerie groan of the trees intensifies. It is almost as if they are speaking, 
or plotting amongst themselves.

[ Exits: south ]
(Golden Aura) The branches of this Ironwood snap shut violently as you get near.

Wandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear 
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf 
floats to the ground slowly before you without hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind after 
all.

You notice the black moon falling to the west.

n
Deeper into the ironwoods
  Deeper into the ironwood forest, the pinging and chopping of axes are but a 
memory ringing through your head. The moaning of the trees has intensified to
take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close 
in on your path, and despite the lack of wind you are certain you see the 
rustling of leaves. In the corner of your eye, a tree stretches luxuriously, 
as if waking from a long slumber.

[ Exits: east south ]
(Golden Aura) A towering ironwood bars your way with a shimmering wooden shield.
(Golden Aura) An Ironwood tree is whispering to its neighbors.
(Golden Aura) An Ironwood rustles here, just to rustle.
(Golden Aura) A sturdy sapling reaches above the others to reach the sunlight above.
(Golden Aura) A slender sapling reaches for the sunlight high above.

Lost in the ironwoods
  The ironwood trees crowd the path here, and the ringing of distant axeblades 
seems to reverberate all around you. In all directions the mighty metallic 
trunks offer no clue as to which way to continue. Pressing forward may take 
you deeper into the forest, although you cannot be certain you haven't 
doubled back on your starting position.

An intersection in the ironwoods
  Barely audible, the ringing of axes upon the ironwood trees is but a 
distraction here. The air is still in this dense thicket, and yet there 
remains an eerie howl amidst the trees. Before you, the trees become too 
dense to pass. In either direction you see a narrow path onward, through the 
ironwood.

Paths divide amidst the ironwoods
  Barely audible, the ringing of axes upon the ironwood trees is but a 
distraction here. The air is still in this dense thicket, and yet there 
remains an eerie howl amidst the trees. Before you, the trees become too 
dense to pass. In either direction you see a narrow path onward, through the 
ironwood.

n
Deep in the ironwoods
  The ironwood trees crowd the path here, and the ringing of distant axeblades 
seems to reverberate all around you. In all directions the mighty metallic 
trunks offer no clue as to which way to continue. Pressing forward may take 
you deeper into the forest, although you cannot be certain you haven't 
doubled back on your starting position.

[ Exits: north south ]
(Golden Aura) This Ironwood is quite the rustler!
(Golden Aura) A tall Ironwood is whispering to its neighbors.
(Golden Aura) Barely a sprout, this tiny Ironwood is learning to rustle.
(Golden Aura) A sapling reaches for the light above, with barely visible budding limbs.

s
Deep in the ironwoods
  Deeper into the ironwood forest, the pinging and chopping of axes are but a 
memory ringing through your head. The moaning of the trees has intensified to
take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close 
in on your path, and despite the lack of wind you are certain you see the 
rustling of leaves. In the corner of your eye, a tree stretches luxuriously, 
as if waking from a long slumber.

[ Exits: north west ]
     (Magic) The molten corpse of An Ironwood sapling lies here dripping.
(Golden Aura) A towering ironwood bars your way with a shimmering wooden shield.
(Golden Aura) A tall Ironwood is whispering to its neighbors.
(Golden Aura) This slender Ironwood rustles for the sake of rustling!

trunks offer no clue as to which way to continue. Pressing forward may take

s
Paths divide amidst the ironwoods
  Barely audible, the ringing of axes upon the ironwood trees is but a 
distraction here. The air is still in this dense thicket, and yet there 
remains an eerie howl amidst the trees. Before you, the trees become too 
dense to pass. In either direction you see a narrow path onward, through the 
ironwood.

[ Exits: north east west ]
     (Magic) The molten corpse of A budding ironwood sapling lies here dripping.
     (Magic) The molten corpse of A sturdy Ironwood sapling lies here dripping.
     (Invis) (Magic) This heavy slab of Ironwood looks like a formidable defense.
(Golden Aura) A tall Ironwood is whispering to its neighbors.
(Golden Aura) Barely a sprout, this tiny Ironwood is learning to rustle.

memory ringing through your head. The moaning of the trees has intensified to
take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close

w
>>    Wandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods were talking. Trees that appear
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf 
floats to the ground slowly before you without hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind after 
all.

[ Exits: north west ]
     (Invis) (Magic) A skittering swarm of tiny bugs chews up everything in it's path.
(Golden Aura) A slender sapling reaches for the sunlight high above.
(Golden Aura) An Ironwood tree is whispering to its neighbors.
(Golden Aura) This Ironwood is quite the rustler!
(Golden Aura) A tiny sapling reaches for the sunlight high above.

Lv 131  G 114319 | Wandering through the ironwoods (NW)
>>    Into the ironwood forest
  As you move further into the forest, an eerie silence fills the air. While 
the chirp of birds and chatter of critters permeated the edge of the forest, 
they remain only faint memories in your ears here. The rhythmic swings of a 
lumberjack's axe are met with the ringing of iron as though it was a 
blacksmith's hammer on an anvil.

[ Exits: east west ]
(Golden Aura) A slender sapling reaches for the sunlight high above.
(Golden Aura) This Ironwood is quite the rustler!
(Golden Aura) A sturdy sapling reaches above the others to reach the sunlight above.
(Golden Aura) A tiny sapling reaches for the sunlight high above.

A dead end in the ironwoods
  The ironwood trees here have grown too thick to proceed. The trunks have 
grown so near each other as to create a formidable wall. The ring of an axe 
is but a distant sound in this corner of the forest. In its absence the
eerie groan of the trees intensifies. It is almost as if they are speaking, 
or plotting amongst themselves.

s
Wandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear 
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf 
floats to the ground slowly before you without hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind after 
all.

[ Exits: north east south ]
(Golden Aura) Barely a sprout, this tiny Ironwood is learning to rustle.

ironwood.

>>    Wandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear 
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf 
floats to the ground before you without a hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind after 
all.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

------------------------------------------------------------
You step inside the fog and find yourself elsewhere.
------------------------------------------------------------
Beachside landing
  Waves gently lap at the glimmering sands here, creating a calming rhythmic 
hum in your ears. Just off the shallow waters you see a group of ships, 
seamen tirelessly unloading supplies. Inland a short distance, you spot a 
makeshift camp positioned just before a towering forest. A dim rainbow arcs 
up in front of the camp like an entryway.

[ Exits: north east west ]

Deep in the ironwoods (2039)

Intersection in the forest
  Barely audible, the ringing of axes upon the ironwood trees is but a 
distraction here. The air is still in this dense thicket, and yet there 
remains an eerie howl amidst the trees. Before you, the trees become too 
dense to pass. In either direction you see a narrow path onward, through the 
ironwood.

[ Exits: east south west ]

w
Lost in the ironwood forest
  The ironwood trees crowd the path here, and the ringing of distant axeblades 
seems to reverberate all around you. In all directions the mighty metallic 
trunks offer no clue as to which way to continue. Pressing forward may take 
you deeper into the forest, although you cannot be certain you haven't 
doubled back on your starting position.

e
Intersection in the forest
  Barely audible, the ringing of axes upon the ironwood trees is but a 
distraction here. The air is still in this dense thicket, and yet there 
remains an eerie howl amidst the trees. Before you, the trees become too 
dense to pass. In either direction you see a narrow path onward, through the 
ironwood.

[ Exits: east south west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  1867/4086 MP  2053/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 122563 | Intersection in the forest (ESW)
>>    
s
Meandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf
floats to the ground slowly before you without hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind 
after all.

[ Exits: north south ]
(Golden Aura) The branches of this Ironwood snap shut violently as you get near.
(Golden Aura) An Ironwood psithurist plays a faint but dulcet tune on its leaves.
(Golden Aura) An Ironwood psithurist plays a faint but dulcet tune on its leaves.

ca scorch 'ironwood'
Lost in the ironwoods
  The ironwood trees crowd the path here, and the ringing of distant axeblades 
seems to reverberate all around you. In all directions the mighty metallic 
trunks offer no clue as to which way to continue. Pressing forward may take 
you deeper into the forest, although you cannot be certain you haven't 
doubled back on your starting position.

e
Meandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf
floats to the ground slowly before you without hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind 
after all.

[ Exits: east west ]

Wandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods are talking. Trees that appear 
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf 
floats to the ground before you without a hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind after 
all.

[ Exits: north east west ]

>>    Into the forest

they remain only faint memories in your ears here. The rhythmic swings of a

blacksmith's hammer on an anvil.

Within the logging camp
  Sawdust fills the air, creating a thick dust that blankets everything in 
sight. The logging camp is purely utilitarian, with large open-air machinery 
lining the main street. A row of cottages is being constructed just off the 
square. Tireless lumberjacks haul trees in from the forest to the north.

[ Exits: north south west ]
A towering and gruff lumberjack is here, directing progress in the camp.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3426/3478 HP  60/4086 MP  2048/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 123782 | Within the logging camp (NSW)
>>    Svrogren's saw mill
  A flat clearing lies before you. In the middle of it stands a massive saw 
mill, spewing sawdust as it tirelessly spins through massive trees. This must
be the heart of the logging operation, and as soon as lumberjacks return to 
camp with a harvest, they drop it with the burly operator here before heading
back out to the woods. He mills log after log, turning even the most massive 
of trees into manageable planks of useable lumber.

[ Exits: east ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) Sparks fly from the mill as whirling blades saw through ironwood lumber.
This stout lumberjack is here to help you operate the saw mill safely.

 lumber to build some sturdy cabins. You should go check in with Svrogan.

 with me, I'll put them to good use."

e
Within the logging camp
  Sawdust fills the air, creating a thick dust that blankets everything in 
sight. The logging camp is purely utilitarian, with large open-air machinery 
lining the main street. A row of cottages is being constructed just off the 
square. Tireless lumberjacks haul trees in from the forest to the north.

[ Exits: north south west ]
A towering and gruff lumberjack is here, directing progress in the camp.
Svrogan says, "You have me thanks KumoGami fur help'n Thomas wit git'n
 camp made."
Svrogan says, "Thomas assure me the cabins will stay plenty warm and keep
 the rain of our wee backs, however we have a bit offa problem now."
Svrogan says, "Ye bitter have a sit an list'n to old Svrogan a minute."
Svrogan pulls up a log and sits on top, inviting you to do the same.
You sit down.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3476/3478 HP  140/4086 MP  2054/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 123782 | Within the logging camp (NSW)
>>    

Svrogan says, "When we came 'ere in search of Ironwood, we all knew the
 tales. We figured they were jist that, a wee story for the wee children.
 Somethin' to teach them to respect nature and learn to use what they
 harvested."

Svrogan exclaims, "They were... just stories!"

Svrogan looks quickly over his shoulder at the sound of rustling in the woods.

Svrogan asks, "Ever since we started harvesting lumber in these woods..
 well the woods have been growing restless. Surely you can hear it in the
 wind?"
Svrogan says, "I need to git me armory up and running as soon as possible,
 so as to replace the axes and other defenses that didn't make the
 landin'."
Svrogan exclaims, "If'n we dun, I fear we meet our childhood story
 monsters. They will drive us back to the sea and these ironwood isles be
 lost to time again!"

Svrogan stands up, looking at you with resolution and the bravery of a man about to send you out to
do his dirty work.
Svrogan says, "You be needin' to venture back into the wood. Don' worry,
 they don't seem to be hostile towards us, least not yet. I need you to
 bring me back a heart of iron from one of the older trees."
Svrogan asks, "You'll haf to find your way into depths of the forest not
 yet seen. At the edge of camp is a rather brazen yet friendly ironwood
 folk. Maybe he can help lead you to the older groves?"
Svrogan exclaims, "The lads been calling him Russell, as he seems to
 respond to a good 'rustle' as a form of greeting. Hurry KumoGami, we be
 needin' that heart of iron!"

** Task Done  : Return to Svrogan
tasks here
** Task Added : Help Svrogan set up the armory


       Logging : Set up camp in the Ironwoods
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Breaking new ground

Svrogan has asked for your help in establishing his logging camp. Proceed 
with care though, as these are uncharted woods.

Task 6  : Help Svrogan set up the armory

Svrogran warns you of a new danger from the ironwoods. It seems they
are not happy with being harvested for wood. 
He has asked you to discover the location of an ancient Ironwood tree and
retrieve the heart of iron that lies within it. While the path to the 
ancient tree lies hidden within the dense forest, Svrogan suggests you 
greet the friendly Ironwood at the edge of the forest with a rustle. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Deeper into the ironwoods
  Deeper into the ironwood forest, the pinging and chopping of axes are but a 
memory ringing through your head. The moaning of the trees has intensified to
take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close 
in on your path, and despite the lack of wind you are certain you see the 
rustling of leaves. In the corner of your eye, a tree stretches luxuriously, 
as if waking from a long slumber.

distraction here. The air is still in this dense thicket, and yet there 
remains an eerie howl amidst the trees. Before you, the trees become too

ironwood.

Lost in the ironwoods

seems to reverberate all around you. In all directions the mighty metallic

Lost in the ironwood forest

Edge of an ancient forest (2048)

Outside of Svrogan's camp (2046)

Into the forest
  As you move further into the forest, an eerie silence fills the air. While 
the chirp of birds and chatter of critters permeated the edge of the forest, 
they remain only faint memories in your ears here. The rhythmic swings of a 
lumberjack's axe are met with the ringing of iron as though it was a 
blacksmith's hammer on an anvil.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  721/4086 MP  2044/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 123782 | Into the forest (NESW)
>>    
rustle
You get your tree on and rustle happily.
Russell exclaims, "Greetings soft one. Your leaves are strangley colored,
 and only come from your apical stem! How interesting you seem!"
Russell exclaims, "But what you lack in leaves, you make up for in spirit!
 You rustle like we were kin!"
Russell rustles at you. Think they deserve a little love?

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  721/4086 MP  2044/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 123782 | Into the forest (NESW)
>>    


Russell says, "Have you met my brother? Not these saplings along the paths
 you travel..."
Russell says, "We have stood here for centuries, shrouded from the outside
 world who sought to drive us from our land."

Russell says, "I am confused by you and your hairy-faced friends. On the
 one hand, you rustle with feeling. On the other, you make our sapplings
 into sticks, and make boxes from these. I watch as you go inside these
 boxes at night, as if afraid of the moon."
Russell says, "What is it you do in there? Wait, don't say. My eldest
 brother Arvid wishes to hear it from you as well."

Russell says, "I will take you to him. But first I need you to help me
 find the way. The way can only be found by a friend of the forest. But
 this friend must be free to find that which is lost. One who is certain of
 the way forward is certain to become lost, and one who is lost is ready to
 find that which does not want to be found."
Russell says, "I do hope you understand me. I cannot say more. Go, bring
 me a friend to lead us to the forgotten groves."
** Task Added : Find the ancient hidden grove

** Task Hint  : Your 'tasks' list has been updated with a new hint.

A nippy, light wind blows from the southwest.
Snow starts to fall softly from the sky.

tasks here

       Logging : Set up camp in the Ironwoods
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Breaking new ground

Svrogan has asked for your help in establishing his logging camp. Proceed 
with care though, as these are uncharted woods.

Task 6  : Help Svrogan set up the armory

Svrogran warns you of a new danger from the ironwoods. It seems they
are not happy with being harvested for wood. 
He has asked you to discover the location of an ancient Ironwood tree and
retrieve the heart of iron that lies within it. While the path to the 
ancient tree lies hidden within the dense forest, Svrogan suggests you 
greet the friendly Ironwood at the edge of the forest with a rustle. 

Task 7  : Find the ancient hidden grove

Russell has offered to take you to meet his brother Arvid, who is the oldest 
of the Ironwood trees here. Russell cannot find his way back to the ancient 
and hidden grove of trees without some help. He has told you to find a friend
of the forest who is able to find the path.

Russell gave you a riddle: 
"The way can only be found by a friend of the forest. But this friend must be
 free to find that which is lost. One who is certain of the way forward is
 certain to become lost, and one who is lost is ready to find that which does
 not want to be found."
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

An intersection in the ironwoods
  Barely audible, the ringing of axes upon the ironwood trees is but a 
distraction here. The air is still in this dense thicket, and yet there 
remains an eerie howl amidst the trees. Before you, the trees become too 
dense to pass. In either direction you see a narrow path onward, through the 
ironwood.

[ Exits: north east south ]

e
Deeper into the ironwoods
  Deeper into the ironwood forest, the pinging and chopping of axes are but a 
memory ringing through your head. The moaning of the trees has intensified to
take the place of the silence. All around you the mighty trees seem to close 
in on your path, and despite the lack of wind you are certain you see the 
rustling of leaves. In the corner of your eye, a tree stretches luxuriously, 
as if waking from a long slumber.

n
Lost in the ironwoods
  The ironwood trees crowd the path here, and the ringing of distant axeblades 
seems to reverberate all around you. In all directions the mighty metallic 
trunks offer no clue as to which way to continue. Pressing forward may take 
you deeper into the forest, although you cannot be certain you haven't 
doubled back on your starting position.

tasks here

       Logging : Set up camp in the Ironwoods
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Breaking new ground

Svrogan has asked for your help in establishing his logging camp. Proceed 
with care though, as these are uncharted woods.

Task 6  : Help Svrogan set up the armory

Svrogran warns you of a new danger from the ironwoods. It seems they
are not happy with being harvested for wood. 
He has asked you to discover the location of an ancient Ironwood tree and
retrieve the heart of iron that lies within it. While the path to the 
ancient tree lies hidden within the dense forest, Svrogan suggests you 
greet the friendly Ironwood at the edge of the forest with a rustle. 

Task 7  : Find the ancient hidden grove

Russell has offered to take you to meet his brother Arvid, who is the oldest 
of the Ironwood trees here. Russell cannot find his way back to the ancient 
and hidden grove of trees without some help. He has told you to find a friend
of the forest who is able to find the path.

Russell gave you a riddle: 
"The way can only be found by a friend of the forest. But this friend must be
 free to find that which is lost. One who is certain of the way forward is
 certain to become lost, and one who is lost is ready to find that which does
 not want to be found."

You notice that when an Ironwood tree is killed, there are many forest 
friends to loot.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

Into the forest
  As you move further into the forest, an eerie silence fills the air. While 
the chirp of birds and chatter of critters permeated the edge of the forest, 
they remain only faint memories in your ears here. The rhythmic swings of a 
lumberjack's axe are met with the ringing of iron as though it was a 
blacksmith's hammer on an anvil.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A mighty ironwood rustles happily here, deftly dodging the lumberjacks' chops.

give pixie russel
You give A lost pixie to Russell.
Russell exclaims, "I knew you could figure it out! I had to be certain you
 were a friend of the forest, and only a friend of the forest would
 recognize that a lost pixie is the key to the forgotten groves!"
Russell exclaims, "You found them! They are yours to follow. Take this
 friendly fae back, and get ready to follow their path!"
You receive A lost pixie from Russell.
Russell says, "Go now, quickly."
As soon as Russell says this the lost pixie flutters away and dives into the foliage, begging you to
follow.
Clearing in the ironwoods
  Stepping out of the thick undergrowth, you emerge in a clearing amidst the 
ironwoods. Above you is sky so bright and blue it briefly blinds you. As your
eyesight acclimates to the light, you see all around you the budding of 
flowers. You spot pixies darting from petal to petal and are overcome by the 
surreal beauty that was otherwise lost, buried within the thick of forest you
came from.

[ Exits: west ]
A lost pixie sits on a low branch asking for directions.
The lost pixie pauses for you to catch up.
  
Russell exclaims: Ho ho! For a soft flesh one you hold up well through the dense brush.

 it is. Just give me a second to get lost again..."

 means, we need to go the other way! Hurry, follow me before I find the
 right direction again!"

** Task Hint  : Your 'tasks' list has been updated with a new hint.

say ready to go
You say 'ready to go'
The lost pixie darts through another series of trees along an unmarked path. The way through is so
dense you are uncertain where your feet land amidst the thick undergrowth.
A hidden ancient grove
  The air here is calm, without the faintest hint of the chopping that is heard
in all other parts of the forest. All about you, the grove is lined by 
massive ironwood trees standing as solemn council to a single ancient tree at
the center. Though barely perceivable, the breeze here rings captivating 
melodies in the trees. Moss covers nearly everything here, untouched by 
outsiders for centuries. What stands before you is among the oldest of the 
living trees in the realm.

[ Exits: other ]
(White Aura) Arvid's gnarled branches welcome you here.

** Task Done  : Find the ancient hidden grove

       Logging : Set up camp in the Ironwoods
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Breaking new ground

Svrogan has asked for your help in establishing his logging camp. Proceed 
with care though, as these are uncharted woods.

Task 6  : Help Svrogan set up the armory

Svrogran warns you of a new danger from the ironwoods. It seems they
are not happy with being harvested for wood. 
He has asked you to discover the location of an ancient Ironwood tree and
retrieve the heart of iron that lies within it. While the path to the 
ancient tree lies hidden within the dense forest, Svrogan suggests you 
greet the friendly Ironwood at the edge of the forest with a rustle. 

Task 8  : Bring back the Heart of Iron

After finding your way to the hidden grove, all that remains is to find a way
to bring the heart of iron back to Svrogan.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3478/3478 HP  3693/4086 MP  2054/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 124705 | A hidden ancient grove (*)
>>    

Arvid, Elder of the Ironwood says, "Welcome, soft one who they call
 KumoGami. Long have I listened to the wind about your arrival. But the
 message the wind carries is ever moving, and while the music it makes is
 certain, the actions it foretells are free to change."

l;ex
A hidden ancient grove
  The air here is calm, without the faintest hint of the chopping that is heard
in all other parts of the forest. All about you, the grove is lined by 
massive ironwood trees standing as solemn council to a single ancient tree at
the center. Though barely perceivable, the breeze here rings captivating 
melodies in the trees. Moss covers nearly everything here, untouched by 
outsiders for centuries. What stands before you is among the oldest of the 
living trees in the realm.

[ Exits: other ]
(White Aura) Arvid's gnarled branches welcome you here.

Arvid, Elder of the Ironwood exclaims, "As I look upon you, soft one, I
 know you come in search of something you do not deserve. Know that if you
 seek to take my heart of iron, it will mean the end of our patience with
 your kind. But be quick about it if you must, and cut it from my ancient
 trunk if you can!"

enter clearing
"clearing"
Clearing in the ironwoods
  Stepping out of the thick undergrowth, you emerge in a clearing amidst the 
ironwoods. Above you is sky so bright and blue it briefly blinds you. As your
eyesight acclimates to the light, you see all around you the budding of 
flowers. You spot pixies darting from petal to petal and are overcome by the 
surreal beauty that was otherwise lost, buried within the thick of forest you
came from.

[ Exits: west ]
A lost pixie sits on a low branch asking for directions.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3126/3478 HP  3760/4086 MP  2054/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 124851 | Clearing in the ironwoods (W)
>>    
w
Wandering through the ironwoods
  Walking through the ironwoods, the clanging sounds of axes upon the hardwood 
fade into the background. In their place, wind whispers through the trees and
deep, creaking groans rise up as if the woods were talking. Trees that appear
much too massive to be doing so, sway in the wind all around you. A leaf 
floats to the ground slowly before you without hint of being carried by the 
lightest breeze, suggesting the noise all around might not be the wind after 
all.

[ Exits: north west ]
     (Invis) (Magic) A skittering swarm of tiny bugs chews up everything in it's path.

(Golden Aura) This Ironwood is quite the rustler!

Into the ironwood forest
  As you move further into the forest, an eerie silence fills the air. While 
the chirp of birds and chatter of critters permeated the edge of the forest, 
they remain only faint memories in your ears here. The rhythmic swings of a 
lumberjack's axe are met with the ringing of iron as though it was a 
blacksmith's hammer on an anvil.

Within the logging camp
  Sawdust fills the air, creating a thick dust that blankets everything in 
sight. The logging camp is purely utilitarian, with large open-air machinery 
lining the main street. A row of cottages is being constructed just off the 
square. Tireless lumberjacks haul trees in from the forest to the north.

[ Exits: north south west ]
A towering and gruff lumberjack is here, directing progress in the camp.

give heart Svrogan

Svrogan says, "Alas! Yev dun it, KumoGami. I'll get right to werk settin'

 hold up fer lifetimes of abuse as me new anvil... "

[*Daily Blessing*] 3126/3478 HP  3760/4086 MP  2046/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 124851 | Within the logging camp (NSW)
>>    

Svrogan says, "Legend has it that any metal hammered out on an anvil made
 of this heart be sharp e'nuff to cut through the roots of this earth.
 We'll have no problem fending off the ironwood if they come for us in our
 camp now."

Svrogan says, "Yev truly dun it! Not only 'ave yer helped build our
 foothold on the Ironwood Isles again, ye'v seen to it that we'll be able
 to stay. I cannot possibly repay you."

Your skin feels soft again.

Svrogan leans into his cabin and grabs a heavy metal box.

Svrogan exclaims, "I can try though. Take this. It'll light yer way
 through the darkest of times and keep you from being caught off guard in
 these here woods. Might be you find use of it along your travels
 elsewhere, too!"
You receive Svrogan's Lantern .{@}. from Svrogan.

goals 131

                     Goal information for: Intrigues of Times Past 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Family Balmtor, once a strong and noble family, lost their status and power
due to an argument, many years ago. With the "sudden" death of the late
king Victor, fingers are being pointed everywhere and at everyone. And
while there are those who seem pleased with the new management, some stand
to lose their lives because of it. Can you solve the murder of the late
king and reinstate family Balmtor as nobility?

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Difficulty       : Medium              
Recommended Level: 195
Minimum Level    : 150
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You have not yet unlocked any of the tasks in this quest.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

[*Daily Blessing*] 3267/3413 HP  3963/4086 MP  2054/2184 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 124851 | Within the logging camp (NSW)
>>    WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) Winger Go Cubs Go! Fly the [W]!.
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (Golden Aura) (White Aura) Tavrin is here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Ruo flies in from the east.

Ruo informs a Grumpy Old General that he has completed his quest.

Ruo scans all directions, looking for signs of life.

Ruo disappears!

Your force shield shimmers then fades away.

You can no longer avoid some attacks.

d
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) (Golden Aura) Qpak the Blacksmith.
(Player) (Red Aura) Forma not formatted.

In The Teeth Of The Gale (G)
  You stare down the teeth of a furious gale, awestruck by the fury
of nature's wrath.  The wind rips through the riggings over your
head, and the main mast creaks alarmingly as the wind steps up
its efforts with a mighty wail.
 
The ship suddenly tilts in an alarming fashion, sending anything
not tied down slamming across the deck and into the ocean.  A
furious clanging indicates the captain is summoning the crew.

[ Exits: east down ]
( 3) A map of the Cape beckons luringly.
Captain Vanderdecker stares into the storm thoughtfully.
The devil waves a contract around temptingly.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3381/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  1984/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 124851 | In The Teeth Of The Gale (ED)

e
On the Flying Dutchman (G)
  You stand in the eye of the storm, the ship calmed as a furious gale
rages all about it.  Waves twice the size of the ship swirl all around you,
but within the circle of peace, the water is as still as a lady's bathtub. 
A cool breeze passing through makes the sails shudder slightly, and the crew
looks nervously around, tightening their grips on the railing.  

[ Exits: east west ]
The devil grins as he tempts another soul to hell.
Captain Vanderdecker signs his soul away with a sigh.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3430/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  2048/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 124851 | On the Flying Dutchman (EW)
>>    
e
Westport Town
  You stand in the center of a bustling town, people all around you
conducting their business and talking with friends.  A crisp breeze brings
you the salty tang of the sea, and the crying of sea birds fills the air. 
The distant sound of the surf echoes in your ear, bringing with it the
memory of the ocean.  The cobblestones beneath your feet are slick with the
sea breeze.  Everywhere you look you are reminded forcibly of the ocean.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A faithless woman stands here searching for a husband to support her.
A townsman hurries along on important business...to him, anyway.
This lady isn't looking for a husband, but doesn't mind a bit of companionship...
A sailor enjoys his well deserved shore leave.
This lady isn't looking for a husband, but doesn't mind a bit of companionship...
This lady isn't looking for a husband, but doesn't mind a bit of companionship...

A Small Shop
  This room is filled with just about everything you could imagine to buy,
including kitchen sinks, wedding accessories, bolts, nuts, fabric, food,
clothing, gifts, memorabilia, and other unidentified sundries...  Whatever
the hell a sundry is.  People flock in and out of the shop constantly,
buying, selling, trading, and just plain stealing.  A large, marmalade cat
suns itself in the window, opening its one eye to give you an evil glare.  

[ Exits: west ]
A sailor enjoys his well deserved shore leave.
A townsman hurries along on important business...to him, anyway.
(White Aura) Sarah thinks of the long nights without her husband.
A shopkeeper digs frantically through his stock, searching for...err...never mind.

Lv 131  G 124851 | Westport Town (ES)
>>    Ms. Sarah's House
  You enter into a lady's bedroom, marvelling at the sheer...  Pinkness of
the room.  The huge bed is draped with pink satin curtains, the floor is
covered with pink rag rugs, and even the fabric covering the chairs and
couches is a brilliant, eye-watering pink.  The windows are covered with
pink shades, and the nightstand is scattered with a lot of boxes and jars
and bags that you really have no great desire to investigate...  The stench
alone is making your eyes water.  A pink shellac desk sits in one corner,
with only a pink pen and a stack of pink parchment on it.  

[ Exits: west ]

On the Deck of the Flying Dutchman
  You stand once more on the deck of the Flying Dutchman, as it departs
from town.  The day is cool and clear, and the sun slowly rises in the east,
beckoning you onwards.  On a day like this, it is impossible to believe in
evil...  A seagull settles on the railing next to you and peers at you
inquisitively, as if to ask if you are giving handouts, and then cries a
long wail and flaps off across the ocean again.  A light breeze springs up,
carrying to you the sounds of singing as the sailors go about their
business.  

[ Exits: east west ]
Antonius looks at his captain with a blank stare of incomprehension.
Captain Vanderdecker looks towards the horizon with hope.

looks nervously around, tightening their grips on the railing.

The devil grins as he tempts another soul to hell.
Captain Vanderdecker signs his soul away with a sigh.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3430/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  2036/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 124851 | On the Flying Dutchman (EW)
>>    In The Teeth Of The Gale (G)
  You stare down the teeth of a furious gale, awestruck by the fury
of nature's wrath.  The wind rips through the riggings over your
head, and the main mast creaks alarmingly as the wind steps up
its efforts with a mighty wail.
 
The ship suddenly tilts in an alarming fashion, sending anything
not tied down slamming across the deck and into the ocean.  A
furious clanging indicates the captain is summoning the crew.

[ Exits: east down ]
( 3) A map of the Cape beckons luringly.
Captain Vanderdecker stares into the storm thoughtfully.
The devil waves a contract around temptingly.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3430/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  2034/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 124851 | In The Teeth Of The Gale (ED)
>>    
listen captain
Captain Vanderdecker says, "I don't feel like talking just now."

[*Daily Blessing*] 3430/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  2034/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 124851 | In The Teeth Of The Gale (ED)
>>    
e
On the Flying Dutchman (G)
  You stand in the eye of the storm, the ship calmed as a furious gale
rages all about it.  Waves twice the size of the ship swirl all around you,
but within the circle of peace, the water is as still as a lady's bathtub. 
A cool breeze passing through makes the sails shudder slightly, and the crew
looks nervously around, tightening their grips on the railing.  

[ Exits: east west ]
The devil grins as he tempts another soul to hell.
Captain Vanderdecker signs his soul away with a sigh.

[*Daily Blessing*] 3430/3478 HP  4086/4086 MP  2028/2054 mv  927tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 124851 | On the Flying Dutchman (EW)
>>    
e
Westport Town
  You stand in the center of a bustling town, people all around you
conducting their business and talking with friends.  A crisp breeze brings
you the salty tang of the sea, and the crying of sea birds fills the air. 
The distant sound of the surf echoes in your ear, bringing with it the
memory of the ocean.  The cobblestones beneath your feet are slick with the
sea breeze.  Everywhere you look you are reminded forcibly of the ocean.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A faithless woman stands here searching for a husband to support her.
A townsman hurries along on important business...to him, anyway.
This lady isn't looking for a husband, but doesn't mind a bit of companionship...
A sailor enjoys his well deserved shore leave.
This lady isn't looking for a husband, but doesn't mind a bit of companionship...
This lady isn't looking for a husband, but doesn't mind a bit of companionship...

e
Ms. Sarah's House
  You enter into a lady's bedroom, marvelling at the sheer...  Pinkness of
the room.  The huge bed is draped with pink satin curtains, the floor is
covered with pink rag rugs, and even the fabric covering the chairs and
couches is a brilliant, eye-watering pink.  The windows are covered with
pink shades, and the nightstand is scattered with a lot of boxes and jars
and bags that you really have no great desire to investigate...  The stench
alone is making your eyes water.  A pink shellac desk sits in one corner,
with only a pink pen and a stack of pink parchment on it.  

[ Exits: west ]

e
On the Deck of the Flying Dutchman
  You stand once more on the deck of the Flying Dutchman, as it departs
from town.  The day is cool and clear, and the sun slowly rises in the east,
beckoning you onwards.  On a day like this, it is impossible to believe in
evil...  A seagull settles on the railing next to you and peers at you
inquisitively, as if to ask if you are giving handouts, and then cries a
long wail and flaps off across the ocean again.  A light breeze springs up,
carrying to you the sounds of singing as the sailors go about their
business.  

[ Exits: east west ]
Antonius looks at his captain with a blank stare of incomprehension.
Captain Vanderdecker looks towards the horizon with hope.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

In the Throne Room (2047)

The Throne Room
  You finally reach the end of the hall and you see that only one of the
three thrones is being used.  You realize that you are in front of the Queen
of Northstar.  You quickly bow to give the proper respect to her.  You look up
and see many workers cleaning a large stain glass window above the queen. 
To the east and west you see hallways leading to other places in the castle.
Perhaps one of them will go to Elena's room.  Standing next to the queen is
Devlin, the queen's bodyguard.  He has sworn to protect her and her family
to the death.

Approaching the Castle (2073)

At the Gates
  As you approach the gates of the Castle, two guards greet you, saying;
"Welcome to Northstar Castle.  May your visit be good".  They move aside to
let you pass.  The sight of the castle fills your eyes with awe for the
people that live in there.  The smooth limestone blocks seem to glimmer as
the sunlight bounces off them.

In the Throne Room (2072)

The Throne Room
  You finally reach the end of the hall and you see that only one of the
three thrones is being used.  You realize that you are in front of the Queen
of Northstar.  You quickly bow to give the proper respect to her.  You look up
and see many workers cleaning a large stain glass window above the queen. 
To the east and west you see hallways leading to other places in the castle.
Perhaps one of them will go to Elena's room.  Standing next to the queen is
Devlin, the queen's bodyguard.  He has sworn to protect her and her family
to the death.

In Front of the Throne Room

castle.  To the north you can see the huge throne room where three thrones
are located.  The ceiling of this part reaches about twenty to thirty feet.

The Throne Room
  You finally reach the end of the hall and you see that only one of the
three thrones is being used.  You realize that you are in front of the Queen
of Northstar.  You quickly bow to give the proper respect to her.  You look up
and see many workers cleaning a large stain glass window above the queen. 
To the east and west you see hallways leading to other places in the castle.
Perhaps one of them will go to Elena's room.  Standing next to the queen is
Devlin, the queen's bodyguard.  He has sworn to protect her and her family
to the death.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

>>    Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of

around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

w
Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

[*Daily Blessing*] 2648/3478 HP  2806/4086 MP  2053/2054 mv  759tnl (Reply: Talbor) 
Lv 131  G 152321 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>    
w
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
